3966561602,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intelligence-analyst-intern-milano-at-rsm-italy-3966561602?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=cy9ibEWA%2F5%2F7KIKuT3%2F8Gg%3D%3D&trackingId=w0ugDFmx9Sjy%2F8HTzY9zYQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Intelligence Analyst Intern - Milano,RSM Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","In the RSM Service line Forensic Investigations & Intelligence, we combine a deep knowledge of corporate intelligence and business investigations with an unconditional love for technology. We move intelligence techniques out of their traditional cloak and dagger ways and apply them to new areas of business, powered by innovation and exceptional people.
Our priority is the well-being of our resources: training, peer education, professional growth and personal development.
We come from the most diverse life and work experiences and provide an exceptional level of service.

We are looking for a person whose fundamental traits are curiosity, imagination and independent thinking. They should be skilled in understanding and breaking down complex issues, prioritizing tasks and connecting the dots with an investigative mindset. We value the personal traits and characteristics that make us different. This is the reason why we welcome people of all nationalities and from almost every discipline.
Due to the sensitivity of the information that RSM deals with, we train and trust our resources to handle confidential information, thinking and acting accordingly.

We are looking to add an intelligence analyst intern to work with the team. As such, you will be tasked with collecting information and coordinating resources, online and offline, regarding companies and individuals, in order to answer our clients’ most diverse strategic questions.
This position will be based at our office in Milan, Italy.
Conduct media and database research using complex search criteria and following a strict methodology
Provide research into potential issues relating to financial crimes, compliance concerns, money laundering, and corruption
Identify and interview human sources to develop intelligence and supplement research
Critically evaluate information on sources, opposed interests and roles in a wide range of industries
Contribute to, improve and develop new tools and procedures to keep our investigative methodology current, relevant and cost-effective
Build and maintain awareness of the broader context and implications of the various types of risk affecting the business (e.g. financial, legal, reputational)
Distil conclusions and identify hidden or indirect connections from research findings
Create thorough reports presenting information in a clear and narrative way
Present findings to Clients during in-person and remote meetings.
EU passport / work permit in the EU
Excellent command of Italian & English, with some life experience outside of your country of birth
Strong research, writing and analytical skills, including ability to summarize information quickly and effectively from multiple sources into concise assessments
An interest in OSINT and some experience in online research
Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office suite, specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Knowledge of and ability to turn information into actionable intelligence
Ability to take ideas from concept to completion, meet deadlines, communicate, and follow up swiftly and thoroughly
Excellent interpersonal skills with an ability to connect the dots organizationally, network effortlessly, influence various roles and profiles to drive collaboration and program excellence
Ability to take direction, feedback, and guidance from management and provide frequent project updates to ensure alignment with team goals
Strong oral/written communication and data presentation skills, including communicating effectively with business and technical teams
Positive attitude and ability to collaborate with others and work as a team.
Command of a third language, German proficiency is a plus
Experience in the fields of corporate intelligence, investigations or due diligence with a recognized company or association
Proficiency in public record, OSINT, investigative, and financial research resources
Advanced command of Excel (vlookups, pivots, macros, etc.).

RSM Italy Corporate Finance S.r.l. is part of RSM International, one of the world’s largest organizations specialized in auditing and tax consulting, corporate and financial with around 64,000 professionals and a presence in 120 countries with over 820 offices.

In Italy we are young and constantly growing (86% of our resources are under 40 years old and 43% are women) where everyone is encouraged and supported to develop their skills through ad hoc training.
We firmly believe in our values, which guide our approach to customers and colleagues:
We look forward to meeting you!

RSM is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer: all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, creed, national origin, age, disability, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis.

Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.
To apply please send a CV.

Intelligence, we combine a deep knowledge of corporate intelligence and business investigations with an unconditional love for technology. We move intelligence techniques out of their traditional cloak and dagger ways and apply them to new areas of business, powered by innovation and exceptional people.

Our priority is the well-being of our resources: training, peer education, professional growth and personal development.


Our resources

We come from the most diverse life and work experiences and provide an exceptional level of service.

We are looking for a person whose fundamental traits are curiosity, imagination and independent thinking. They should be skilled in understanding and breaking down complex issues, prioritizing tasks and connecting the dots with an investigative mindset. We value the personal traits and characteristics that make us different. This is the reason why we welcome people of all nationalities and from almost every discipline.

Due to the sensitivity of the information that RSM deals with, we train and trust our resources to handle confidential information, thinking and acting accordingly.


The position

We are looking to add an intelligence analyst intern to work with the team. As such, you will be tasked with collecting information and coordinating resources, online and offline, regarding companies and individuals, in order to answer our clients’ most diverse strategic questions.

This position will be based at our office in Milan, Italy.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. With a presence in over 160 countries and around 18 production facilities, we pride ourselves on our cutting-edge technology and commitment to sustainability. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and it is fueled by our commitment to the inclusion of unique perspectives and different experiences. Because power is nothing without our people!
We are offering a rewarding role with scope for career progression along with:

Within the Quality team, the Quality Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing quality data and supporting quality improvement & innovation. He/she will have the opportunity to gain an overview from both a business and an industrial perspective, with the main aim of driving continuous improvement.
*Acquire, filter and analyze the data from various data sources with methodic approach and with the aim of optimize efficiency and quality in the process.
*Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective and preventive actions to address quality issues and prevent recurrence.
*Develop and implement quality standards and specific project for Quality, digital-oriented.
*Conduct analysis and evaluation of existing manufacturing processes, identifying areas for improvement and recommending appropriate solutions.
*Monitor and analyze process performance metrics and develop strategies to meet or exceed targets.
*Identify and implement process control measures, including statistical process control (SPC) techniques, to ensure consistent quality and reduce process variation.
*Perform process capability studies, statistical analysis and data-driven decision-making to achieve operational excellence and meet quality targets
*Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve quality issues effectively.
*Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques for quality improvement.
*Technical tools knowledge: JMP, Mathlab, MS Project.
WHAT PUTS YOU IN POLE POSITION
*Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
*Detail-oriented with good organizational and time management skills.

Job description:

DISCOVER PIRELLI
We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. With a presence in over 160 countries and around 18 production facilities, we pride ourselves on our cutting-edge technology and commitment to sustainability. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and it is fueled by our commitment to the inclusion of unique perspectives and different experiences. Because power is nothing without our people!

WHY JOIN US
We are offering a rewarding role with scope for career progression along with:
*Canteen.
*Flexible working hours.
*On-site health clinic.
*Remote Working.
*Employee benefits.

DRIVE YOUR FUTURE
Within the Quality team, the Quality Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing quality data and supporting quality improvement &
column2:
innovation. He/she will have the opportunity to gain an overview from both a business and an industrial perspective, with the main aim of driving continuous improvement.

YOUR CORE ACTIVITIES
*Acquire, filter and analyze the data from various data sources with methodic approach and with the aim of optimize efficiency and quality in the process.
*Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective and preventive actions to address quality issues and prevent recurrence.
*Develop and implement quality standards and specific project for Quality, digital-oriented.
*Conduct analysis and evaluation of existing manufacturing processes, identifying areas for improvement and recommending appropriate solutions.
*Monitor and analyze process performance metrics and develop strategies to meet or exceed targets.
*Identify and implement process control measures, including statistical process control (SPC) techniques, to ensure consistent quality and reduce process variation.
*Perform process capability studies, statistical analysis and data-driven decision-making to achieve operational excellence and meet quality targets

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
*Master's Degree.
*Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve quality issues effectively.
*Good knowledge of English and Italian.
*Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques for quality improvement.
*Technical tools knowledge: JMP, Mathlab, MS Project.

WHAT PUTS YOU IN POLE POSITION
*Data-driven mindset and approach.
*Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
*Detail-oriented with good organizational and time management skills.

APPLY NOW, DRIVE YOUR FUTURE!
#WePirelli

3629189535,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-stage-at-sdg-group-italy-3629189535?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=cy9ibEWA%2F5%2F7KIKuT3%2F8Gg%3D%3D&trackingId=sg1AKFOjrikTHOn4h0Lmzw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Junior Data Analyst - Stage,SDG Group Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","In SDG hai l’opportunità di diventare un esperto di Big Data & Analytics e di entrare a far parte di una delle società più all’avanguardia d’Europa in questo ambito. Potrai partecipare a diversi progetti nazionali e internazionali lavorando in team giovani e dinamici. Vengono effettuate valutazioni periodiche di performance e acquisizione di skills che ti permetteranno di fare velocemente carriera nella nostra realtà. Avrai inoltre modo di costruire il tuo career path personalizzato scegliendo tra diversi percorsi. Partendo da un livello base, attraverso training, coaching, mentoring, e un approccio never-stop-learning diventerai un esperto nella progettazione e sviluppo di practices con le quali far adottare ai nostri clienti un’ottica data driven.
Acquisire una conoscenza dei big data & analytics a 360°: data architecture, data management, data visualization e data analysis
Sviluppare hard skills nell’utilizzo delle tecnologie di business intelligence e soft skills per relazionarsi con il cliente e il proprio team di lavoro
Capacità di muoversi e interagire in un ambiente internazionale, rapido e dinamico assumendosi gradualmente maggiori responsabilità e autonomia nei tasks

Technology attitude: SQL, VBA, R, Python, tecnologie di Business Intelligence, Data manipulation, Data Management sono solo il punto di partenza ma non preoccuparti se la tua conoscenza è a un livello base: abbiamo un Learning Center per renderti velocemente un Data Cruncher.

Team player: un buon giocatore di squadra è una persona altruista, dinamica, entusiasta, resiliente e positiva. Sono elementi alla base dei Valori SDG e lavoriamo per far crescere una cultura dei valori a tutti i livelli.
Capacità di elaborare informazioni aziendali complesse e di presentarle con sensibilità agli stakeholder aziendali.
Conoscenza lingua inglese: B1/B2 (verrà testata in sede di colloquio)

Academy interne e centri di eccellenza qualificati con possibilità di ottenere certificazioni per i tools più utilizzati nel campo dei big data & analytics: Qlik, PowerBI, Tableau, Microstrategy, SAP Analytics, AWS Redshift, Oracle DB, SQL Server, Google Bigquery, Snowflake etc.

Never stop learning: formazione continua per tutto l’arco della carriera con 80 ore di training iniziale e successiva attività di coaching e mentoring. Valutazioni semestrali del potenziale e della performance.
Ambiente internazionale e giovane: età media inferiore a 30 anni e possibilità di trasferte all’estero.

Lavorare in SDG significa entrare a far parte di una delle società di management consulting in più rapida crescita nell’ambito dei Business Analytics, Corporate performance Management e Advanced Business Solutions. Con più di 2000 professionisti in tutto il mondo è stata riconosciuta da Gartner tra le 37 società più all’avanguardia nel settore dei Data & Analytics, l’unica italiana e seconda in Europa. SDG opera in Italia con 4 uffici (Milano, Firenze, Verona e Roma) e dislocamenti in Spagna, Portogallo, Francia, UK, USA e Middle East. Mettiamo la nostra esperienza nel settore degli Analytics a disposizione delle aziende per potenziare le loro strategie di business, facendole diventare organizzazioni data-driven di successo.

3954874557,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-quality-analyst-at-sennder-3954874557?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=cy9ibEWA%2F5%2F7KIKuT3%2F8Gg%3D%3D&trackingId=uzZfiIQk0sh0By%2FN6KUB4g%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Quality Analyst,sennder,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Data Quality Analyst (fixed-term contract)

sennder is Europe’s leading digital freight forwarder. In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitize and automate all road logistics processes. We are a growing team looking for a Data Quality Analyst to help us on our journey to revolutionise road freight logistics. You would join our “Operations Program & Innovation” department, based out of the Milan office and will report to the Team Lead Ops. Quality.

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

As a Data Quality Analyst you’ll work on interesting responsibilities like supporting the Operations Programs & Innovation department and specifically the Network Quality Team by analyzing and identifying logistic network inefficiencies, managing carriers delays and penalties.
Ensure compliance with service quality KPIs by monitoring and supporting continuous performance improvement.
Work together with carriers to reduce the impact of low performances through bonus/malus mechanisms.
Analyze operational issues by identifying their root causes and proposing corrective actions through daily KPIs monitoring (e.g., on-time performance, incidents).
Build supplier performance reports in order to create presentations useful to management.
Support the definition of processes with the aim of identifying best practices and improving performance.
Work closely with Operations and Program Management teams to improve our quality metrics.
Develop and maintain relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
Bachelor's degree in economics, statistics, engineering, or equivalent work experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Italian and English.
Proficiency in G-Suite and MS Office (Excel & PowerPoint)
column2: essential proficiency in SQL.

column1: Strong analytical skills to conduct analyses and translate them into actionable insights.
Proactive, self-starter with excellent organizational skills.
Strong interpersonal skills and adaptive mindset with the ability to learn quickly.
Strong team player with a collaborative attitude.

sennder Italia, based in the heart of Milan, is a joint venture company between sennder and Poste Italiane. Our company matches the digital and innovative focus on technologies and digitalization of sennder with the expertise and know-how of the largest distribution network in Italy, Poste Italiane.

We not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we’re growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe’s inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Read more about the sennder Italia joint venture here.

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual potential of all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit and respect to build fruitful collaboration across teams. Learn more about who we are on our career site.
Fast growth scale-up with an international team of 1000 people, 74+ nationalities spread across 11 European offices. With English as our common language, we are able to work together.
Learning and development on the job and with the support of a bi-annual review process, learning allowance, high potential programs, sennder onboarding academy, and internal trainings.
Various opportunities to connect with colleagues through regular team events and company get-togethers such as our highly anticipated sennder Summer Camp.
Prioritize employee engagement and mental well-being by fostering a supportive environment through the Likeminded platform and conducting regular employee satisfaction surveys.
Hybrid work model where you seamlessly merge virtual productivity and in-office collaboration with your colleagues.
Commuter allowance to assist employees with their daily travel expenses and a one-time home office benefit to ensure that you're properly equipped wherever you work.
Competitive compensation package including objective-based bonus, referral reward, and in some cases virtual option plan.
For the Milan office we offer: free on-site gym!
Vibrant offices complete with healthy snacks, focus zones, and social areas to connect with your colleagues. Click [here] for a virtual tour and better yet, hope to see you soon!

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.
If you have any questions or need special accommodation please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. As soon as you apply your journey with sennder begins.

3973970762,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/supply-data-analyst-internship-at-ogury-3973970762?position=10&pageNum=2&refId=cy9ibEWA%2F5%2F7KIKuT3%2F8Gg%3D%3D&trackingId=O%2Fkg5hZdE4hL%2FQkOajbVUQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Supply Data Analyst - Internship,Ogury,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Ogury is a global adtech company that delivers Personified Advertising solutions grounded in privacy to brands, agencies and publishers by focusing on targeting personas, not people.

We deliver relevant audiences at scale and on quality publisher inventory thanks to our exclusive data, which is meticulously collected and crafted from millions of self-declared customer surveys, enriched with billions of impactful data points, and refined by AI. This results in audience insights and performance not available through any other AdTech platform.
Founded in 2014, Ogury is a global organization with a diverse team of 500+ people across 17 countries.

At Ogury, our vision unites us all. But we know that it takes people from all walks of life to come together and make it happen. We embrace and celebrate what makes us different, creating a unique and winning culture where everyone feels safe, has access to the same opportunities, and is excited about bringing their most authentic self to work. Everyday.

Together we’re changing the face of adtech with values that inspire excellence, standards that encourage a leadership mindset, and an inclusive workplace where Ogurians are engaged and know they belong.

Ogury is seeking a highly motivated Supply Data Analyst Intern to help our efforts towards data analysis. The intern will assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support our business decisions and strategic initiatives. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis and work within a dynamic and innovative tech environment.

Data Collection and Cleaning: Assist in gathering data from multiple sources, including internal databases, spreadsheets, and third-party data systems. Perform data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Help maintain data quality and support data management activities.

Data Analysis: Conduct basic statistical analyses and generate reports to identify trends and patterns. Support senior analysts with more complex data analysis tasks. Utilize tools such as Excel, SQL for data manipulation and analysis.

Reporting and Visualization: Create data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Metabase as the main tool. Present analytical findings to team members and stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

Support and Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Assist in developing and implementing data collection systems and strategies to optimize data efficiency and quality.
Learning and Development: Stay current with industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance analytical skills and knowledge.
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.

column2: knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools such as Metabase is a plus.

About The Role

Ogury is seeking a highly motivated Supply Data Analyst Intern to help our efforts towards data analysis. The intern will assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support our business decisions and strategic initiatives. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis and work within a dynamic and innovative tech environment.

What You Will Do

  • Data Collection and Cleaning: Assist in gathering data from multiple sources, including internal databases, spreadsheets, and third-party data systems. Perform data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Help maintain data quality and support data management activities.
  • Data Analysis: Conduct basic statistical analyses and generate reports to identify trends and patterns. Support senior analysts with more complex data analysis tasks. Utilize tools such as Excel, SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
  • Reporting and Visualization: Create data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Metabase as the main tool. Present analytical findings to team members and stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
  • Support and Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Assist in developing and implementing data collection systems and strategies to optimize data efficiency and quality.
  • Learning and Development: Stay current with industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance analytical skills and knowledge.

About You

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Excel

3971180648,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/mpim-analytics-intern-at-levi-strauss-co-3971180648?position=1&pageNum=5&refId=MFwc6Fw%2B1V54vQF7YX7VUQ%3D%3D&trackingId=vqK6AwQ6GMUaLxvcmmVADQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,MPIM Analytics Intern,Levi Strauss & Co.,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Job Description
We believe that clothes — and how you make them — can make a difference.

Since 1853, we’ve been passionate about innovation to meet people’s needs. We invented the first blue jean. And we reinvented khaki pants. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines for our manufacturing partners. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do.

A company doesn’t last 160 years by standing still. It endures by reinventing itself, striving to delight its consumers, winning in the marketplace, and by remaining true to its values. We employ more than 17,000 people around the world – supporting great brands, including Levi’s®, Dockers® and Denizen®. Our employees are committed to progress, authenticity and collaboration.
We're seeking for a motivated, data-driven Intern to join us at the Analytics team in Italy for our Merchandising Planning and Inventory Management (MPIM) Department.

Are you excited to learn more about Supply Chain and the Fashion industry? About using your analytic and problem-solving skills to tackle real life data problems? Do you want to be part of a young and dynamic team
column2: while working in the European HQ of one of the most iconic global apparel brands? if so, do hesitate to apply!

column1: Being point of contact for analytics and data inquiries
Creating data pipelines, dashboards and reports for use across Europe’s business
Cooperating with cross-functional partners to reach resolutions on data topics and build data products
Performing data wrangling and exploration in support of ad-hoc analysis requests and to feed predictive modelling.
Providing assistance to the extended team
You speak fluently English (any other EU language is a plus)
You have excellent analytical and communication/presentation skills
You hold a Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Engineering / Operational research / Econometrics/Economics and Business Management
You have knowledge in SQL and/or R/Python
Organized with meticulous attention to detail, ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
You are flexible and able to perform in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable learning new tools. (Dataiku, Tableau, Excel, SAS etc.)
Start date: Asap for 6 months renewable.
Great work experience in an international, energetic and fun environment
Great opportunity to work for the world’s number one denim brand
Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Job Description

We believe that clothes — and how you make them — can make a difference.

Since 1853, we’ve been passionate about innovation to meet people’s needs. We invented the first blue jean. And we reinvented khaki pants. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines for our manufacturing partners. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do.

A company doesn’t last 160 years by standing still. It endures by reinventing itself, striving to delight its consumers, winning in the marketplace, and by remaining true to its values. We employ more than 17,000 people around the world – supporting great brands, including Levi’s®, Dockers® and Denizen®. Our employees are committed to progress, authenticity and collaboration.

We're seeking for a motivated, data-driven Intern to join us at the Analytics team in Italy for our Merchandising Planning and Inventory Management (MPIM) Department.

Are you excited to learn more about Supply Chain and the Fashion industry? About using your analytic and problem-solving skills to tackle real life data problems? Do you want to be part of a young and dynamic team
column2:
while working in the European HQ of one of the most iconic global apparel brands? if so, do hesitate to apply!

About The Job

  • Being point of contact for analytics and data inquiries
  • Creating data pipelines, dashboards and reports for use across Europe’s business
  • Cooperating with cross-functional partners to reach resolutions on data topics and build data products
  • Performing data wrangling and exploration in support of ad-hoc analysis requests and to feed predictive modelling.
  • Providing assistance to the extended team

About You

  • You speak fluently English (any other EU language is a plus)
  • You have excellent analytical and communication/presentation skills
  • You hold a Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Engineering / Operational research / Econometrics/Economics and Business Management
  • You have knowledge in SQL and/or R/Python
  • Self-motivated, problem solver, team player
  • Organized with meticulous attention to detail, ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
  • You are flexible and able to perform in a fast-paced environment
  • Comfortable learning new tools. (Dataiku, Tableau, Excel, SAS etc.)

Start date: Asap for 6 months renewable.

What We Offer

  • Great work experience in an international, energetic and fun environment
  • Great opportunity to work for the world’s number one denim brand

LOCATION

Milan, Italy

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&
column3: Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

3976698980,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-commercial-planning-control-and-reporting-at-mbcredit-solutions-3976698980?position=2&pageNum=5&refId=MFwc6Fw%2B1V54vQF7YX7VUQ%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FEzYH%2FZO%2Bale7hkbg%2F8Oag%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,"Data analyst - Commercial planning, control and reporting",MBCredit Solutions,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","MBCredit Solutions S.p.A. è la società del Gruppo Mediobanca attiva nella gestione del credito per primarie aziende italiane ed internazionali che operano nel territorio nazionale.

Energia, Entusiasmo e professionalità sono le leve che portano la squadra di MBCredit Solutions ad essere vincente. Il team è composto soprattutto da giovani talenti, che trovano in azienda un ambiente dinamico in cui esprimersi e realizzarsi.

Offriamo un ambiente in cui vivere quotidianamente i nostri valori e ci impegniamo a tradurre questi ultimi in azioni concrete, in primo luogo verso le nostre persone: - assunzione di persone con alto potenziale di crescita
column2: - valorizzazione delle risorse interne
column3: - formazione “on the job” grazie al trasferimento di esperienza
column4: - cura ed attenzione alle aspirazioni professionali di ognuno
column5: - sviluppo delle capacità manageriali
column6: - professionalità, equità e trasparenza.

column1: La ricerca, attivata per MBCredit Solutions, società del Gruppo Mediobanca, è volta a brillanti laureate/i in Economia, Ingegneria, Scienze Statistiche, Informatica o Data Science, con pregressa esperienza di 2 anni in ambito business intelligence, data modelling e analisi dati per altre realtà bancarie o primarie realtà di consulenza.
La risorsa verrà inserita nell’Ufficio Pianificazione, Controllo Commerciale & Business Intelligence, a diretto riporto del responsabile, all’interno della Direzione Sales & Operations.

La risorsa si occuperà principalmente attività di analisi, manipolazione e modellizzazione dati attraverso applicativo SAS al fine di predisporre report e analisi di valore sull’attività di recupero crediti.

Desideriamo entrare in contatto con candidate/i che abbiano un’ottima conoscenza di strumenti di analisi quantitativa, dei principali linguaggi di programmazione tra cui SAS, Python ed R, dimestichezza con SQL ed una conoscenza avanzata del pacchetto office (in particolare Microsoft Excel). Inoltre, è richiesta la conoscenza della lingua inglese.
Costituirà titolo preferenziale conoscenza del mondo credit management/NPL e dei processi di gestione del credito, nelle sue varie accezioni.
Completano il profilo un'ottima capacità organizzativa, spiccate attitudini analitiche e di problem solving, capacità di lavorare per obiettivi ed una buona propensione al lavoro in team.

Per le aziende del Gruppo Mediobanca la diversità e l’inclusività sono valori fondamentali. Le persone interessate verranno considerate nel rispetto della diversità, valorizzando differenti caratteristiche di età, cultura, abilità e orientamento o espressione di genere.

column1: La nostra ambizione è sviluppare software insieme ai nostri clienti per riorganizzare l’Azienda, diventando protagonisti della Rivoluzione Digitale.
La risorsa verrà inserita nel ruolo di Consulente Business Intelligence e gestirà clienti in Lombardia con le seguenti mansioni:
Formazione e assistenza agli utenti delle aziende clienti
Analisi dati per la creazione di Report di livello enterprise
Partecipazione nei momenti di interfacciamento con i responsabili di funzione delle aziende clienti
Collaborazione nello sviluppo di applicazioni di Business Intelligence e modelli predittivi tramite strumenti di BI (Qlik Sense, Power BI)
La figura ideale per poter ricoprire il ruolo di Consulente Business Intelligence è in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:
Laurea in Economia, Statistica, Matematica, Informatica o percorsi affini
Conoscenza, almeno teorica, di strumenti di analisi statistica come R, Python, MATLAB
Passione per l’innovazione, i numeri, la gestione e l’analisi dei dati
Attitudine alle relazioni interpersonali, flessibilità, determinazione
Welfare aziendale e upgrade su obiettivi di crescita

Cultura Aziendale:


Le persone sono il cuore del nostro successo. Grazie al loro valore Sanmarco Informatica, dagli anni ‘80 ad oggi, è diventata, da piccola realtà familiare, una delle più grandi realtà italiane.

Nei nostri team ci sono esperti di processo, ingegneri, cultori della bellezza, informatici e consulenti

La nostra ambizione è sviluppare software insieme ai nostri clienti per riorganizzare l’Azienda, diventando protagonisti della Rivoluzione Digitale.


Il profilo

La risorsa verrà inserita nel ruolo di Consulente Business Intelligence e gestirà clienti in Lombardia con le seguenti mansioni:

  • Formazione e assistenza agli utenti delle aziende clienti
  • Analisi dati per la creazione di Report di livello enterprise
  • Partecipazione nei momenti di interfacciamento con i responsabili di funzione delle aziende clienti
  • Collaborazione nello sviluppo di applicazioni di Business Intelligence e modelli predittivi tramite strumenti di BI (Qlik Sense, Power BI)


Competenze richieste

La figura ideale per poter ricoprire il ruolo di Consulente Business Intelligence è in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:

  • Laurea in Economia, Statistica, Matematica, Informatica o percorsi affini
  • Conoscenza, almeno teorica, di strumenti di analisi statistica come R, Python, MATLAB
  • Passione per l’innovazione, i numeri, la gestione e l’analisi dei dati
  • Attitudine alle relazioni interpersonali, flessibilità, determinazione
  • Disponibilità a trasferte


Si offre

  • Welfare aziendale e upgrade su obiettivi di crescita
  • Formazione
  • Team collaborativo e presente
  • Strumentazione lavoro da remoto


Sede di lavoro

Lombardia e Clienti

3959654927,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/hr-data-analyst-at-kpmg-italy-3959654927?position=6&pageNum=5&refId=MFwc6Fw%2B1V54vQF7YX7VUQ%3D%3D&trackingId=OAXOtQ5nxoZ48z3I22fC%2BQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,HR Data Analyst,KPMG Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We believe in the highest standards. After all, the first step in ensuring high-quality services for our clients is to operate internally at the highest levels. KPMG Support professionals have the fundamental task of supporting the daily activities of colleagues in the Business, with dedication and proactivity.
For the strengthening of our People structure in Milan, we are looking for an HR Data Analyst professional who will be responsible for the following activities:
Create, develop, and update reporting systems for the Management
Support the maintenance of data and oversee the accuracy of information in company systems
Conduct analyses on the data available in the HR information system
Contribute to the creation of interactive dashboards focused on personnel analysis to drive the overall human resources strategy
Support HR processes with data and statistics.
To be the ideal candidate, you should possess:
2-4 years of previous experience in the role
Excellent knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite
Good knowledge of the English language
Passion and enthusiasm for HR issues, curiosity, and proactivity, flexible approach, and respect for deadlines.
Are you a problem solver who never loses sight of your goals? Can you build strong relationships and promote collaboration? You might be the person we are looking for!
KPMG is one of the leading networks of professional services, a leader in audit and accounting, management consulting, and tax, legal, and administrative services.

Leadership, teamwork, respect for people, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity. These are the values of KPMG that guide the behaviors of the people who work there, representing its identity and way of being, creating an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge that allows our professionals to express their full potential.
Our role is a prominent one in a context of continuous and rapid change, requiring a set of new skills and abilities to support growth ambitions and the trust the market places in us.
Driven by passion, we strive every day to promote inclusion and growth, fostering an environment where everyone feels they belong.

The requested data will be processed in absolute compliance with the provisions of European Regulation 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"" or ""Privacy Regulation"") and its subsequent amendments and integrations. For more information, please refer to KPMG's Privacy Policy.
KPMG Business Services ensures equal opportunities.

3798604070,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-warehouse-analyst-at-fineco-bank-3798604070?position=7&pageNum=5&refId=MFwc6Fw%2B1V54vQF7YX7VUQ%3D%3D&trackingId=%2F7fZYq%2BuFEYVFFjx5fzR5g%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Warehouse Analyst,Fineco Bank,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Descrizione azienda

FinecoBank è una banca multicanale che offre, in un unico conto, servizi di banking, credit, trading e investimento. E’ leader in Europa nel brokerage e dispone di una delle maggiori reti di consulenti finanziari, con un network capillare di Fineco Center in tutta Italia. FinecoBank è una delle più importanti banche FinTech in Europa, oltre ad essere uno dei più importanti player nel Private Banking in Italia, con un approccio consulenziale altamente tailor-made che include servizi fiduciari, di protezione e trasmissione del patrimonio personale e aziendale, consulenza legale e fiscale e gestione degli eventi di discontinuità.

La funzione ICT sviluppa e gestisce le applicazioni software e l'infrastruttura tecnologica della Banca. Promuove la razionalizzazione in azienda di tutti i processi di lavoro, a supporto delle linee di business, tramite la rilevazione delle esigenze di servizi informatici e promozione delle opportunità tecnologiche offerte dall'evoluzione del sistema informativo.
Inserita all'interno dell'area Data Warehouse, la persona da noi ricercata sarà chiamata a svolgere le seguenti attività:
Analizzare le esigenze degli utenti interni in termini di reporting e analisi.
Disegnare e implementare le procedure di integrazione dati dai sistemi alimentanti.
Definire e implementare i reports e le analisi sui dati.
Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o Statistica/Matematica.
Interesse verso le tematiche di modellazione dati, sviluppo e gestione database, business intelligence.
Conoscenza di almeno un database fra MS SQL Server, MS Access, Oracle, Sybase, MySQL.
Conoscenza di un qualche tool di business intelligence (per esempio PowerBI).
Si desidera entrare in contatto con persone che si distinguono per le ottime capacità relazionali, affidabilità ed autonomia organizzativa.
Completano il profilo una forte determinazione ed orientamento al risultato, una personalità vivace e proattiva, con ottime capacità organizzative e doti di riservatezza e affidabilità.
Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)
Tipo di contratto: CCNL credito, tempo indeterminato

Il Gruppo Fineco è orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversità, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro. Fineco “The Place To Be”

Descrizione azienda

FinecoBank è una banca multicanale che offre, in un unico conto, servizi di banking, credit, trading e investimento. E’ leader in Europa nel brokerage e dispone di una delle maggiori reti di consulenti finanziari, con un network capillare di Fineco Center in tutta Italia. FinecoBank è una delle più importanti banche FinTech in Europa, oltre ad essere uno dei più importanti player nel Private Banking in Italia, con un approccio consulenziale altamente tailor-made che include servizi fiduciari, di protezione e trasmissione del patrimonio personale e aziendale, consulenza legale e fiscale e gestione degli eventi di discontinuità.

Posizione

La funzione ICT sviluppa e gestisce le applicazioni software e l'infrastruttura tecnologica della Banca. Promuove la razionalizzazione in azienda di tutti i processi di lavoro, a supporto delle linee di business, tramite la rilevazione delle esigenze di servizi informatici e promozione delle opportunità tecnologiche offerte dall'evoluzione del sistema informativo.

Descrizione dell'attività

Inserita all'interno dell'area Data Warehouse, la persona da noi ricercata sarà chiamata a svolgere le seguenti attività:

  • Analizzare le esigenze degli utenti interni in termini di reporting e analisi.
  • Esplicitare i fabbisogni informativi.
  • Disegnare e implementare le procedure di integrazione dati dai sistemi alimentanti.
  • Definire e implementare i reports e le analisi sui dati.


Requisiti

  • Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o Statistica/Matematica.
  • Interesse verso le tematiche di modellazione dati, sviluppo e gestione database, business intelligence.
  • Conoscenza di almeno un database fra MS SQL Server, MS Access, Oracle, Sybase, MySQL.


Costituiscono Titolo Preferenziale

  • Esperienza con Analysis Services (SSAS).
  • Conoscenza di un qualche tool di business intelligence (per esempio PowerBI).


Si desidera entrare in contatto con persone che si distinguono per le ottime capacità relazionali, affidabilità ed autonomia organizzativa.

Completano il profilo una forte determinazione ed orientamento al risultato, una personalità vivace e proattiva, con ottime capacità organizzative e doti di riservatezza e affidabilità.

Altre informazioni

Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Tipo di contratto: CCNL credito, tempo indeterminato

Il Gruppo Fineco è orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversità, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro. Fineco “The Place To Be”

3966586524,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-%E2%80%93-data-platform-analytics-at-sky-italia-3966586524?position=8&pageNum=5&refId=MFwc6Fw%2B1V54vQF7YX7VUQ%3D%3D&trackingId=wc%2BgyHbPTeuC%2BIkOMXu7SA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Engineer – Data Platform & Analytics,Sky Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","As a member of the Data Platform & Analytics you will developing the best of breed big data analytics platform for Sky. You are never satisfied with a good enough solution, but you are always looking on better ways to solve problems, providing a world class data infrastructure and services.
You will work on complex, challenging and exciting enterprise-level data solutions/programmes which needs to be solved with simple and high quality solutions.
- Contribute to the overall system design/architecture and implementation, understanding requirements and problems to be solved and translating these into data engineering solutions.

- Develop and maintain the data flows, ingesting raw data from different sources or data platforms, transforming it through a set of tools into intuitive data models, KPI and allowing to act on this data.
- Help to foster innovation and good engineering practices (testing, continuous integration/delivery, pair programming, software design patterns, …)
- Excellent problem solving skills, creative and entrepreneurial
- Experience designing highly available, scalable and distributed end to end data flows
- Strong experience in the whole software development lifecycle, including code versioning systems (Git) and CI/CD
- Experience with OO programming (Scala, Java, Python, C++, …)
- Experience with relational databases (Oracle, MySQL, Postgres, …)
- Experience with scripting languages (Bash, Perl, Python, Ruby, …)
- Experience with “Big Data” technologies on Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services or Azure
Experience with Big Data platforms and engines (Apache Hadoop, Apache Kafka, Apache Spark,
- Computer science or technically related degree
- Professional knowledge of English language, written and spoken
- Able to work in a fast paced environment
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

3967078784,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/legal-data-analysis-internship-at-generali-italia-3967078784?position=10&pageNum=5&refId=MFwc6Fw%2B1V54vQF7YX7VUQ%3D%3D&trackingId=c%2F3Kop5sUtlhyqr15Z8YLg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Legal Data Analysis Internship,Generali Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","La struttura Distribution Oversight nell'ambito dell'area Country General Counsel di Generali Italia è responsabile di presidiare il controllo della rete distributiva. In questo ambito la struttura Data Analysis, Planning, Reporting & Methodology si occupa di raccogliere, monitorare e analizzare una grande quantità di dati relativa all'emissione di polizze, alla loro gestione e all'andamento delle ispezioni, al fine di svolgere attività predittiva e supportare le ispezioni stesse con interventi mirati.
Per la struttura Data Analysis stiamo cercando un/una tirocinante da inserire nel team per contribuire alle seguenti attivittà:
Analisi di potenziali irregolarità o frodi verso clienti finali, anche attraverso i risultati del Distribution Oversight Control System 2024 (DOCS24) e degli elementi che li hanno determinati
Valutazioni di opportunità in merito all’evoluzione degli attuali indicatori di rischio e alla realizzazione di nuovi, individuandone le interdipendenze
Reportistica interna ed esterna, con elaborazione e archiviazione della relativa documentazione
Il/la candidato/a ideale è in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:
Laurea, preferibilmente in discipline a orientamento giuridico
Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Microsoft Office e di Excel
Capacità di approfondire processi e procedure aziendali
Dimestichezza su temi di Information Technology
Capacità di analisi dati e di sintesi
Essere Partner di Vita è la nostra ambizione: ogni giorno vogliamo essere al fianco dei nostri clienti prendendoci cura delle loro vite e dei loro sogni. Questo per noi è Più di un Lavoro.
Siamo parte di un importante Gruppo internazionale con oltre 72 mila persone in tutto il mondo e più di 68 milioni di clienti.
Siamo tra i principali player globali del settore assicurativo: l’innovazione e la sostenibilità sono nel nostro DNA.

Generali Italia conta oltre €24,6 miliardi di premi totali e una rete capillare di 40 mila distributori, oltre ai canali online e di bancassurance. 13 mila dipendenti, €120 miliardi di asset under management. A Generali Italia fanno capo Alleanza Assicurazioni, Das, Leone Alato, Genertel, Generali Welion e Generali Jeniot.
Il Gruppo Generali offre delle interessanti opportunità di arricchimento professionale in un contesto lavorativo caratterizzato da:
Cultura aziendale solida e aperta, modi di lavorare innovativi, formazione e affiancamento a supporto di un inserimento efficace
Ambiente di lavoro inclusivo in cui tutti si sentano accolti, liberi di esprimere al meglio la propria identità, le proprie idee e le proprie capacità: perché siamo Più che diverse, Persone Uniche
Qualità dei processi e iniziative per le nostre persone, che ci distinguono come Top Employer
Entra a far parte della nostra squadra, non esitare a candidarti subito!

3962763898,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-stageur-at-ing-italia-3962763898?position=1&pageNum=7&refId=DW5m5x2SvGYacr%2BVN1d9ew%3D%3D&trackingId=AUBq%2FWXZ6arVzgNdZXNwdg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Junior Data Analyst Stageur,ING Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Candidate will interact with business in gathering functional and technical requirements related to Tribe’s assets and enhance software applications through coding and testing, involved in code reviews and training. He/she will be work with data and use data to generate value.
He/She will support the business in gathering requirements, feed functional and technical analysis, development and testing activities.

He/She will create project documentation and coordinate technical issues, know the business rules and concepts, guidelines specifications and designs provided by the chapter lead and apply them in completing the assigned task.
He/she will deliver highest quality software by creating unit test plan and testing code thoroughly.
Adept with the tools, applications, and processes used for software development, implements solutions as designed in technical documentation specification and coding standards.
He/She will be responsible for the quality of the code release in production and for the timeliness of the production running.
Application development according to ING Bank standards.
Work in an agile team in adherence with the solution design and enterprise architect team.
Follow and support Business in gathering requirements.
Write high quality functional and technical documentation.
Implement high quality code and propose/implement optimization on code design.
Design, write and perform Unit Tests and Functional Tests.
Work with Release team for code versioning management.
Follow and support team defect and bug identification and resolution during test phase.
Candidate has or is studying for a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Information Technology/Engineering (computer/telecommunications)
He/she has knowledge or work experience in any of the following programming languages or technologies: Unix, Oracle SQL, IBM DataStage platform.
He/she has knowledge in bug-fixing and code optimization
He/she is a good team player in a different culture
He/she has the ability to learn in a short time and work a dynamic environment
He/she has good English knowledge (written and spoken)
He/she has very good communication skills, pro-active and easy to approach attitude.

ING offers many opportunities to build a diverse and rewarding career. You will be joining an international innovative digital bank, the first in Italy to adopt a fully flexible smart working model, and you will be working in a stimulating environment where you can grow both as an individual and as a professional.Our purpose - empowering people to stay a step ahead in life and in business - represents our belief in people’s potential. We don’t judge, coach or to tell people how to live their lives. We empower people and businesses to realize their own vision for a better future.
#doyourthing is our brand direction with us each and every day. It is how we articulate our purpose and our promise to make banking frictionless to the world.
‘do your thing’ is about people being free to live the life they want to live, knowing that they will make their world a little better for it.
Do you think you are ""a step ahead""? Apply now!
In addition to being a part of a great team, working in a fun and innovative environment, we offer:
Competitive base salaries and performance based bonuses
Lots of training development opportunities to help you grow
Lots of moments dedicated to physical and mental well-being
A special day off when it is your birthday: we call it #doyourbirthday!
And of course we can’t forget: free water & coffee at the office!

Diversity is a fundamental element of our corporate culture, and we are fully committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment, based on mutual respect and the value of diversity, offering equal job opportunities to all qualified candidates.

Candidate will interact with business in gathering functional and technical requirements related to Tribe’s assets and enhance software applications through coding and testing, involved in code reviews and training. He/she will be work with data and use data to generate value.

He/She will support the business in gathering requirements, feed functional and technical analysis, development and testing activities.


He/She will create project documentation and coordinate technical issues, know the business rules and concepts, guidelines specifications and designs provided by the chapter lead and apply them in completing the assigned task.


He/she will deliver highest quality software by creating unit test plan and testing code thoroughly.

Adept with the tools, applications, and processes used for software development, implements solutions as designed in technical documentation specification and coding standards.

He/She will be responsible for the quality of the code release in production and for the timeliness of the production running.


Your Key Responsibilities:

  • Application development according to ING Bank standards.
  • Work in an agile team in adherence with the solution design and enterprise architect team.
  • Follow and support Business in gathering requirements.
  • Write high quality functional and technical documentation.
  • Implement high quality code and propose/implement optimization on code design.
  • Design, write and perform Unit Tests and Functional Tests.
  • Work with Release team for code versioning management.
  • Follow and support team defect and bug identification and resolution during test phase.
  • Identify and resolve production issue.


What are we looking for?

  • Candidate has or is studying for a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Information Technology/Engineering (computer/telecommunications)
  • He/she has knowledge or work experience in any of the following programming languages or technologies: Unix, Oracle SQL, IBM DataStage platform.
  • He/she has knowledge in bug-fixing and code optimization
column2: • He/she is a good team player in a different culture
column3: • He/she has the ability to learn in a short time and work a dynamic environment
column4:
• He/she has good English knowledge (written and spoken)

We don’t judge, coach or to tell people how to live their lives. We empower people and businesses to realize their own vision for a better future.


    #doyourthing is our brand direction with us each and every day. It is how we articulate our purpose and our promise to make banking frictionless to the world.

    ‘do your thing’ is about people being free to live the life they want to live, knowing that they will make their world a little better for it.

    Do you think you are ""a step ahead""? Apply now!


    The benefits of joining ING

    • Super flexible smart working
    • Competitive base salaries and performance based bonuses
    • Diverse cultures &

3963912089,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/brand-performance-analyst-insights-and-analytics-at-landor-3963912089?position=3&pageNum=7&refId=DW5m5x2SvGYacr%2BVN1d9ew%3D%3D&trackingId=bJU12rticxNWRYlEty8UOg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Brand Performance Analyst (Insights and Analytics),Landor,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Landor is looking for a Brand Performance Analyst (Insights and Analytics) to join our Milan studio. Could this be you?
Bringing every facet of brand to life.​
Creating brand-led experiences for talent & customers.​
​United in our drive to make a positive difference.​
We build brands, designed to transform.​
Our Landor Group also includes leaders in sonic branding amp, workspace & architectural design experts BDG and award-winning motion specialists ManvsMachine.​
Play a crucial role in enabling data-driven decision-making. Support our clients in making confident, impactful brand strategy and design choices to drive business growth.

Collaborate on projects with Strategy, Client Services, and Design teams to create world-class, agile brands that unlock business growth and provide quantifiable predictions for the performance and business benefits of our solutions and recommendations.
Serve our clients for ad hoc consulting projects, including but not limited to brand strategy, brand equity, brand-led business case modeling, brand valuation, and setting financial KPIs.

Execute the data analytics strategy for projects, synthesizing insights, determining priorities, and identifying information gaps to help inform brand strategy, working independently or coordinating with team members.
Collaborate in defining and create brand-led business cases, financial models, and value propositions for industry-leading brands seeking to understand brand and/or business transformation.
Support the management of supplier agency relationships to ensure successful project delivery and proper framework setup.
Nurture a positive culture inside the Team and across the Network.
Previous experience in a similar role with knowledge on how insight and analytics play their part in supporting brands’ growth.
Basic experience in translating insights from research and data into recommendations on client brand, business strategies and stories
Familiarity with a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies, tools, and approaches.
Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
Good stakeholder management and interpersonal skills, allowing you collaborating with individuals from various disciplines outside of the Brand Performance realm and clients.
Proficient in English and native/bilingual in Spanish or Italian, bonus for any other fluent language.
Our commitment to diversity and inclusion
We believe diversity brings creativity, which is at the heart of everything we do. We are actively engaging in creating an environment free of discrimination.

Landor is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee based on race, colour, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law.

Landor is looking for a Brand Performance Analyst (Insights and Analytics) to join our Milan studio. Could this be you?


We are Landor.​

World-leading brand specialists.​

Consulting. Design. Experience.​

Connecting business strategy to brand.​

Bringing every facet of brand to life.​

Creating brand-led experiences for talent &
column2:
customers.​

​United in our drive to make a positive difference.​

Proudly part of WPP.​

We build brands, designed to transform.​

Our Landor Group also includes leaders in sonic branding amp, workspace &
column3:
architectural design experts BDG and award-winning motion specialists ManvsMachine.​


What you’ll do

  • Play a crucial role in enabling data-driven decision-making. Support our clients in making confident, impactful brand strategy and design choices to drive business growth.
  • Collaborate on projects with Strategy, Client Services, and Design teams to create world-class, agile brands that unlock business growth and provide quantifiable predictions for the performance and business benefits of our solutions and recommendations.
  • Serve our clients for ad hoc consulting projects, including but not limited to brand strategy, brand equity, brand-led business case modeling, brand valuation, and setting financial KPIs.
  • Execute the data analytics strategy for projects, synthesizing insights, determining priorities, and identifying information gaps to help inform brand strategy, working independently or coordinating with team members.
  • Collaborate in defining and create brand-led business cases, financial models, and value propositions for industry-leading brands seeking to understand brand and/or business transformation.
  • Support the management of supplier agency relationships to ensure successful project delivery and proper framework setup.
  • Nurture a positive culture inside the Team and across the Network.


What you’ll need

  • Previous experience in a similar role with knowledge on how insight and analytics play their part in supporting brands’ growth.
  • Basic experience in translating insights from research and data into recommendations on client brand, business strategies and stories
  • Familiarity with a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies, tools, and approaches.
  • Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
  • Good stakeholder management and interpersonal skills, allowing you collaborating with individuals from various disciplines outside of the Brand Performance realm and clients.
  • Proficient in English and native/bilingual in Spanish or Italian, bonus for any other fluent language.


Our commitment to diversity and inclusion

We believe diversity brings creativity, which is at the heart of everything we do. We are actively engaging in creating an environment free of discrimination.


Landor is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee based on race, colour, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law.

3979130645,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-rgi-group-3979130645?position=4&pageNum=7&refId=DW5m5x2SvGYacr%2BVN1d9ew%3D%3D&trackingId=xTTf2uP7QCpxDGmW%2BbLYRg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST,RGI Group,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","RGI is the insurtech leader in Europe, driving the digital transformation of the insurance sector in EMEA through technology.
We have been committed for more than 35 years to the Insurance industry.
RGI has a wealth experience in dealing with Insurers, Bank Insurers, Agents, Brokers, independent Financial Advisors.

With more than 1.200 professionals in Italy, France & Luxembourg, DACH & Slovenia, Ireland, Africa & Middle East, we have a proven track record of successfully collaborating with 130 Insurers and 300 brokers across the EMEA region, supporting them on their journey to excellence.
The candidate will work in the R&D Product Factory, as part of the Business Intelligence & AI team with other experts in the field and will report to the BI & Data Science Lead.
The main activities required to the selected candidate aims at consolidating and widening the general knowledge and technological knowhow of RGI in the field of the Business Intelligence.
Implement reports and dashboards leveraging best in class business intelligence tool (e.g. Qlik Sense)
Conduct analysis on insurance business topics: interview with client, formalization of business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports and dashboards
Design & build management information dashboards to monitor internal processes and answer business questions about trends, opportunities, and data quality issues
Became responsible of specific project stream, ensuring a high level of data quality for core data sources and relevant KPIs
Research tools, frameworks and mechanisms for data analytics providing input to new technology opportunities that will have an impact on the company BI systems

Collaborate with Data Scientists in the RGI R&D Innovation Department, contributing in the development of new algorithms and models, providing application with vertical focus on the Insurance Industry
Experiences: 1-3 years’ experience in a Business intelligence and Analytics position.
Previous experience with a business intelligence tool (Qlik Sense, Tableau, Power Bi, etc.)
Proficiency in database query construction and data mining (SQL, PL/SQL)
Experience in ETL tools (e.g. Talend, IBM DataStage, Business Objects, Alteryx, etc.) and management of databases is a strong plus
Knowledge with one of the following languages: Python, R, MATLAB, SAS is a plus
Proven capability to quickly grasp new processes and technologies.
Knowledge of big data architecture and data manipulation tools, based on Cloudera and HortonWorks (e.g. Apache Spark, Elasticsearch, Kafka….) is a plus
Willingness of learning and delivering innovation-based products to a wider audience
Attention to detail, passion for processes, systems and data mining
Education: Master’s Degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or a related quantitative discipline.

This announcement is addressed to candidates of both sexes pursuant to the law (L.903 / 77 and Legislative Decree No. 98/2006, art. 27). The interested party is invited to send his / her application by giving specific consent to the processing of personal data, pursuant to the new European Privacy Law, in accordance with articles 13 and 14 of the GDPR (Regulation (EU), 27 April 2016, n. 2016/679).

Entra nella practice Management Consulting di PwC e diventa:

Gestirai sfidanti progetti di trasformazione del business dei principali players in ambito Consumer Markets, Financial Services, Energy&Utilities, Government & Healthcare, Telco&Media attraverso attività di consulenza manageriale basata su un approccio data-driven.
Grazie all’accesso alle vaste competenze del nostro network internazionale, potrai dare spazio alle tue idee e fornire il contributo innovativo che hai sempre desiderato.
Con l’Experience Consulting, aiuterai i nostri clienti ad esplorare nuove opportunità di business principalmente nei seguenti ambiti:
Data Visualization e Reporting applicate al Marketing
Sarai Coinvolto Con Crescenti Responsabilità Nelle Seguenti Attività
Disegno e sviluppo di report e dashboard tramite strumenti di data visualization in ambito Marketing e Customer Insight
Analisi sul comportamento di consumo e digitale dei Clienti attraverso esplorazione di dati strutturati e destrutturati per derivare insight di business
Attività di gestione e valutazione quantitativa delle campagne di marketing e di tracciamento dei dati di digital analytics
Raccolta, disegno e formalizzazione requisiti progettuali a diretto contatto con il cliente
Hai una laurea magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Gestionale, Statistica, Econometria, Matematica, Fisica

Hai maturato esperienza di 1-2 anni in Aziende Leader nel proprio mercato di riferimento e/o in primarie Società di consulenza all’interno di progetti relativi a Data Visualization e Customer Analytics: analisi dati, interpretazione di ampi data set sul mercato di consumo, rappresentazione di KPI ed Insight di business

Hai padronanza di strumenti di Data Visualization (es. Microsoft PowerBI, Tableau, QlikSense), di spreadsheet software (es. Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets) e hai un approccio data-driven nel trovare nuove soluzioni
Parli e scrivi in inglese fluentemente
Sei in grado di trovare soluzioni funzionali, creative ed innovative a progetti complessi
Sai lavorare per obiettivi e metterti in gioco con passione e senza limiti
Sai lavorare in team e creare un ambiente di lavoro stimolante e positivo
Le tue ottime capacità relazionali e comunicative ti permetteranno di instaurare rapporti di fiducia con i clienti e il team
Sei fortemente motivato a consolidare la tua carriera professionale in consulenza.
Se hai queste caratteristiche, PwC Consulting composta da oltre 2.000 professionisti è il posto giusto per te. Unisciti alla nostra squadra!
Ti sentirai subito a casa ed avrai l’opportunità di fare la differenza contribuendo alla crescita delle aree Strategy e Management Consulting.
