<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.
The role of a Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.
This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.
Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
What your day will look like
Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards
What we are looking for in you?
Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
🏠Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
📚Personal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum
🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like

  • Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
  • Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
  • Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
  • Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
  • Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards

What we are looking for in you?

  • Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
  • Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
  • Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
  • Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
  • Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
  • Excellent writing and communication skills
  • Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges

What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

🏠Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

📚Personal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

💰Annual compensation review

🏆Recognition rewards

🏝 Annual holiday leave

👶Parental Leave

🧑‍💼Employee Assistance Programme

🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

3971191047,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internal-audit-digitalization-data-analyst-%40bmed-at-banca-mediolanum-3971191047?position=7&pageNum=7&refId=DW5m5x2SvGYacr%2BVN1d9ew%3D%3D&trackingId=tgLgRb0Fhf4C0GhKOddSQw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Internal Audit - Digitalization & Data Analyst @Bmed,Banca Mediolanum,"Basiglio, Lombardy, Italy","Società

All’interno Della Funzione Internal Audit Della Capogruppo Banca Mediolanum Siamo Alla Ricerca Di Una Risorsa Come Internal Audit Digitalization & Data Analyst Che Avrà Il Compito Di Contribuire Alla Realizzazione Del Programma Strategico Di Digitalizzazione Della Funzione Attraverso
Interazione con gli altri team della Funzione per recepire le esigenze di digitalizzazione ed analisi dati, finalizzate al rafforzamento delle verifiche di Audit
Individuazione delle fonti e dei dati pertinenti e necessari e conseguenti attività di pulizia e trasformazione
Analisi e visualizzazione dei dati ottenuti, anche attraverso l’utilizzo di tecnologie come data mining, data exploration, al fine di supportare le attività di controllo della Funzione IA
Implementazione ed evoluzione degli strumenti informatici a supporto delle attività di audit
Laurea in economia, statistica o altre discipline STEM
Conoscenza del ruolo e delle attività svolte dalle Funzioni di Internal Audit in ambito bancario e finanziario
Esperienza, presso società di revisione, consulenza oppure Funzioni di Internal Audit, Compliance, Risk Management
Partecipazione a progetti di digitalizzazione ed analisi dati a fini di controllo, maturata in ambito bancario/finanziario
Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione e/o degli strumenti di Data Analisys e Data Visualization (SQL, Python, R, SAS, Power BI etc.)
Dimestichezza con la mappatura/ estrazione di dati all’interno di database aziendali.
La conoscenza applicata di tecniche statistiche per l’analisi e l’elaborazione dei dati sarà ritenuta un titolo preferenziale.
Sede di lavoro: Basiglio (Milano 3city). Possibilità di smartworking settimanale.

I dati richiesti verranno trattati nell’assoluto rispetto delle disposizioni contenute nel Regolamento Europeo 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR” o “Normativa Privacy”) e sue successive modificazioni ed integrazioni.
E’ possibile visionare l’informativa di Banca Mediolanum SPA, accedendo al seguente link: https://www.bancamediolanum.it/privacy/candidature.
Gruppo Mediolanum si impegna a garantire la parità di trattamento a tutti i candidati secondo i principi di Diversity and Inclusion

column3:
Data Analyst Che Avrà Il Compito Di Contribuire Alla Realizzazione Del Programma Strategico Di Digitalizzazione Della Funzione Attraverso

  • Interazione con gli altri team della Funzione per recepire le esigenze di digitalizzazione ed analisi dati, finalizzate al rafforzamento delle verifiche di Audit
column4: • Individuazione delle fonti e dei dati pertinenti e necessari e conseguenti attività di pulizia e trasformazione
column5: • Analisi e visualizzazione dei dati ottenuti, anche attraverso l’utilizzo di tecnologie come data mining, data exploration, al fine di supportare le attività di controllo della Funzione IA
column6:
• Implementazione ed evoluzione degli strumenti informatici a supporto delle attività di audit


    • Requisiti Tecnici e Professionali

    • Laurea in economia, statistica o altre discipline STEM
column7: • Conoscenza del ruolo e delle attività svolte dalle Funzioni di Internal Audit in ambito bancario e finanziario
column8:
• Esperienza, presso società di revisione, consulenza oppure Funzioni di Internal Audit, Compliance, Risk Management
  • Partecipazione a progetti di digitalizzazione ed analisi dati a fini di controllo, maturata in ambito bancario/finanziario
column9: • Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione e/o degli strumenti di Data Analisys e Data Visualization (SQL, Python, R, SAS, Power BI etc.)
column10:
• Dimestichezza con la mappatura/ estrazione di dati all’interno di database aziendali.

    • La conoscenza applicata di tecniche statistiche per l’analisi e l’elaborazione dei dati sarà ritenuta un titolo preferenziale.


    Sede di lavoro: Basiglio (Milano 3city). Possibilità di smartworking settimanale.


    I dati richiesti verranno trattati nell’assoluto rispetto delle disposizioni contenute nel Regolamento Europeo 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR” o “Normativa Privacy”) e sue successive modificazioni ed integrazioni.

    E’ possibile visionare l’informativa di Banca Mediolanum SPA, accedendo al seguente link: https://www.bancamediolanum.it/privacy/candidature.


    Gruppo Mediolanum si impegna a garantire la parità di trattamento a tutti i candidati secondo i principi di Diversity and Inclusion

Nota Società di Prodotto multinazionale, composta da oltre 3000 dipendenti, operante in ambito finanziario, è alla ricerca di un Data Engineer per uno dei principali progetti aziendali: lo sviluppo di un nuovo Data Warehouse in Cloud.
Avrai la possibilità di disegnare, costruire e (a tendere) manutenere l'infrastruttura dati, che alimenterà l’attività di analisi.
Creare e mantenere data warehouse scalabili e ad alte prestazioni
Progettare, sviluppare e implementare pipeline di dati ETL (Extract, Transform, Load)
Garantire la qualità, la sicurezza e la governance dei dati
Automatizzare i processi di data engineering per migliorare l'efficienza e la ridondanza
Collaborare con data scientist e analisti per comprendere le loro esigenze e fornire loro i dati necessari per il loro lavoro
Stare al passo con le ultime tecnologie e tendenze in materia di data engineering
Sviluppare e documentare codice pulito, efficiente e manutenibile
Supporto alla attività di problem solving del senior management, tramite la raccolta ed elaborazione di dati di diversa natura, con compilazione di analisi dedicate.
Elaborare analisi complesse per supportare la comprensione e la soluzione dei problemi
Mappare le logiche di business, i processi e i relativi modelli dati
Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica o disciplina affine
Almeno 3 anni di esperienza lavorativa come Ingegnere dei Dati o ruolo simile
Esperienza con linguaggi di programmazione come Python, Java o Scala
Esperienza con database relazionali e non relazionali (es. MySQL, PostgreSQL, Hadoop, SQLServer)
Esperienza degli strumenti Confluent, BigQuery e dell’ambiente Google Cloud
Conoscenza dei principi di data governance e sicurezza dei dati
Conoscenza di reporting tool come Tableau, Looker o Power BI
Conoscenza di strumenti di data engineering come Apache Spark, Airflow o AWS Glue
Buona conoscenza della lingua francese e/o spagnola
Un ambiente di lavoro giovane, stimolante e non gerarchico
Colleghi altrettanto appassionati con cui confrontarti e imparare (e anche a cui insegnare qualcosa di nuovo!)
Possibilità di contribuire da protagonista a uno dei progetti più importanti in ambito dati
Opportunità di veder riconosciuti i tuoi meriti indipendentemente dalla tua seniority
Incontri periodici di feedback che ti permetteranno di accrescere la tua professionalità e migliorare le tue performance
Momenti di aggregazione, condivisione e celebrazione dei successi
Iniziative volte alla formazione ed allo scambio di competenze
Opportunità di collaborare con i colleghi internazionali su dedicati progetti.
La sede di lavoro è a Milano e si offre un regime di lavoro flessibile, con almeno 3 giorni settimanali da remoto.
Budget: 45K – La RAL offerta sarà flessibile, commisurata alle effettive competenze tecniche riscontrate in fase di colloquio.

Data Engineer - End User – Smart Working


Nota Società di Prodotto multinazionale, composta da oltre 3000 dipendenti, operante in ambito finanziario, è alla ricerca di un Data Engineer per uno dei principali progetti aziendali: lo sviluppo di un nuovo Data Warehouse in Cloud.


Avrai la possibilità di disegnare, costruire e (a tendere) manutenere l'infrastruttura dati, che alimenterà l’attività di analisi.


Responsabilità:

  • Creare e mantenere data warehouse scalabili e ad alte prestazioni
  • Progettare, sviluppare e implementare pipeline di dati ETL (Extract, Transform, Load)
  • Garantire la qualità, la sicurezza e la governance dei dati
  • Automatizzare i processi di data engineering per migliorare l'efficienza e la ridondanza
  • Collaborare con data scientist e analisti per comprendere le loro esigenze e fornire loro i dati necessari per il loro lavoro
  • Stare al passo con le ultime tecnologie e tendenze in materia di data engineering
  • Sviluppare e documentare codice pulito, efficiente e manutenibile
  • Supporto alla attività di problem solving del senior management, tramite la raccolta ed elaborazione di dati di diversa natura, con compilazione di analisi dedicate.
  • Elaborare analisi complesse per supportare la comprensione e la soluzione dei problemi
  • Mappare le logiche di business, i processi e i relativi modelli dati


Requisiti:

  • Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica o disciplina affine
  • Almeno 3 anni di esperienza lavorativa come Ingegnere dei Dati o ruolo simile
  • Esperienza con linguaggi di programmazione come Python, Java o Scala
  • Esperienza con database relazionali e non relazionali (es. MySQL, PostgreSQL, Hadoop, SQLServer)
  • Esperienza degli strumenti Confluent, BigQuery e dell’ambiente Google Cloud
  • Conoscenza dei principi di data governance e sicurezza dei dati


Plus:

  • Conoscenza di reporting tool come Tableau, Looker o Power BI
  • Conoscenza di strumenti di data engineering come Apache Spark, Airflow o AWS Glue
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua francese e/o spagnola


Cosa si offre:

  • Un ambiente di lavoro giovane, stimolante e non gerarchico

    Budget: 45K – La RAL offerta sarà flessibile, commisurata alle effettive competenze tecniche riscontrate in fase di colloquio.

3982419612,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-randstad-digital-belgium-3982419612?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=n2iH8Z6oB8pu59O1KokBxw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,Randstad Digital Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Analyst/data engineer
Our organisation is gaining maturity at the level of data management, data engineering and BI reporting. An experienced Data Analyst/Data engineer is needed in this context.
Main focus will be to support business in the creation & documentation of various reporting and dashboards (Payment transactions, Accounting, KYC, Logistics...).
The analyst will also have the opportunity to take part in some business and functional analyses activities.
As a Data Analyst/Data Engineer (s)he should be able to :
Communicate efficiently with business departments to gather, understand and translate business needs into clear requirements.
Get a clear view of all the data sources and data available
Identify which data are required to build the expected extraction and reporting
Collect and integrate data and perform data preparation and transformations in a secure manner, in order to produce reusable key data sets
Use these key data sets to produce reportings and analysis for our internal customers as well as regulatory reportings
Create clear documentation on the data collection and transformations
For this, you should be able to :
Build reports via Salesforce reporting module and/or build dashboards via Tableau or Power BI.
Export, merge and transform data with Power Query in case the data have not been integrated yet
column2: data security by design is key !

column1: Ensure data quality by implementing controls on the imported and produced data.
Discover trends and insights that could bring value to the business.
Organise and document functionally implemented data integrations and reports

Required experience and knowledge Solid practical experience as a data engineer of at least 5 years is needed in the activities listed on the Function Description for which resource needs to take the lead.
You have a solid IT background and know all about data modelling, data documentation, data collecting and transforming and GDPR/data protection, building good data structures.

You've worked in a BI context previously (Accounting, Billing, payment transaction, terminal management environment), capturing and delivering data in a structured manner, with reusable key data sets. You have developed dashboards and reportings. You know do's and don'ts to build such deliverables.
Good experience with IT activities (data models, API, data manipulation and transformation (doc included)

column2: Experience with market ETL/ELT tools is an advantage.

3958541582,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-consultant-at-pwc-belgium-3958541582?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=z6Le6OTjqYEtwAbRdKu%2BAg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Junior Data Analyst Consultant,PwC Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Line of Service
Contribute to creating a better tomorrow

The only way we can tackle the challenges of this fast-changing world is with passionate people. Led by our purpose of building trust and solving important problems, we come together at PwC to address the biggest issues facing the world in a way that drives positive impact. Are you eager to join a team fuelled by open and curious minds? People who are passionate about their work and create new solutions for a new day? Then you’re at the right place.
Bring your talent. Learn new skills. Make a positive impact.

PwC Advisory is a garden of possibilities, and you’re reaping the rewards. Where you want to make an impact is always up to you. With the full support of our Advisory teams, you’ll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you’ll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that’s making a difference.
We’re looking for a talented Junior Data Analytics Consultant to join our Technology Consulting department as of September 2024.
As a Data Consultant, you’ll make an impact by:
Help clients by providing efficient data analysis to reach a better understanding of their business
Guide clients from strategy through execution when facing digital challenges

Leverage the value of enterprise knowledge and big data to help clients evolve towards insights-driven organisations by going through the whole “data” range: data architecture, business intelligence, machine learning, data science, visualisation and reporting
Enable business growth for our top tier clients and create unique experiences for their people and customer base
Use your knowledge and expertise to contribute to the success of our projects with and for our clients
You have a bachelor’s or a master’s degree in business, data analytics, informatics, engineering or computer sciences, or any other relevant degree that showcases your capabilities
You have a strong interest in technologies and the opportunities they offer as well as a good understanding of how to leverage them
You are fluent in English and Dutch and/or French
You are creative and eager to solve challenging problems
You have an analytical mindset, a can-do attitude and great communication skills
You enjoy being client facing as from day one
You are eager to work in multi-disciplinary teams with consultants from various backgrounds, while also being able to work flexible and independently
You are keen to take on new challenges and to continuously learn
You are sociable and communicative, while embracing an inclusive environment
You are people-oriented and look forward to being part of an international family
You are looking for lifelong experience as well as a learning from failure culture
Our culture and workplace are something we’re proud of. Here’s a sneak peek at some of the benefits you can look forward to.
Flexibility: flexible working hours so you can decide your most effective working pattern.
Infinite learning and growing: broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.
Rewards that matter to you: a flexible rewards plan gives you access to a wide range of benefits so you can make the choices that best fit your personal circumstances and lifestyle.

Diversity & inclusion: we believe that diversity makes PwC stronger. It helps us solve important problems and deliver added value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be the best versions of themselves. We organise various D&I initiatives, including an active employee-led Employee Resource Group (ERG) community, comprising 9 diversity groups with over 200 PwC employees aiming to make an impact within and beyond PwC.
A sustainable mobility offer: we offer a comprehensive mobility budget with a wide range of options (hybrid and electric cars, bike leasing, mobility card or loan reimbursement).

Well-being: an extensive health and well-being programme that includes access to professional sport coaching, individual sessions, sports communities and mental health resources. We encourage a healthy lifestyle with regular wellness challenges and various catering options at our cafeteria.
Team events such as Last Friday Drinks, quarterly themed parties, team-building days and celebrations, as well as time spent on community days and charity activities.
International PwC network: broad access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms.
Supporting you in every phase of your life, including family friendly work schemes.
Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)
Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)

column2:
Summary

Contribute to creating a better tomorrow

The only way we can tackle the challenges of this fast-changing world is with passionate people. Led by our purpose of building trust and solving important problems, we come together at PwC to address the biggest issues facing the world in a way that drives positive impact. Are you eager to join a team fuelled by open and curious minds? People who are passionate about their work and create new solutions for a new day? Then you’re at the right place.

Bring your talent. Learn new skills. Make a positive impact.

PwC Advisory is a garden of possibilities, and you’re reaping the rewards. Where you want to make an impact is always up to you. With the full support of our Advisory teams, you’ll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you’ll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that’s making a difference.

We’re looking for a talented Junior Data Analytics Consultant to join our Technology Consulting department as of September 2024.

Your impact

As a Data Consultant, you’ll make an impact by:

  • Help clients by providing efficient data analysis to reach a better understanding of their business
  • Guide clients from strategy through execution when facing digital challenges
  • Leverage the value of enterprise knowledge and big data to help clients evolve towards insights-driven organisations by going through the whole “data” range: data architecture, business intelligence, machine learning, data science, visualisation and reporting
  • Enable business growth for our top tier clients and create unique experiences for their people and customer base
  • Use your knowledge and expertise to contribute to the success of our projects with and for our clients

About You

  • You have a bachelor’s or a master’s degree in business, data analytics, informatics, engineering or computer sciences, or any other relevant degree that showcases your capabilities
  • You have a strong interest in technologies and the opportunities they offer as well as a good understanding of how to leverage them
  • You are fluent in English and Dutch and/or French
  • You are creative and eager to solve challenging problems
  • You have an analytical mindset, a can-do attitude and great communication skills
  • You enjoy being client facing as from day one
  • You are eager to work in multi-disciplinary teams with consultants from various backgrounds, while also being able to work flexible and independently
  • You are keen to take on new challenges and to continuously learn
  • You are sociable and communicative, while embracing an inclusive environment
  • You are people-oriented and look forward to being part of an international family
  • You are looking for lifelong experience as well as a learning from failure culture

Life at PwC Belgium

Our culture and workplace are something we’re proud of. Here’s a sneak peek at some of the benefits you can look forward to.

  • Flexibility: flexible working hours so you can decide your most effective working pattern.
  • Infinite learning and growing: broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.
  • Rewards that matter to you: a flexible rewards plan gives you access to a wide range of benefits so you can make the choices that best fit your personal circumstances and lifestyle.
  • Diversity &
column3: inclusion: we believe that diversity makes PwC stronger. It helps us solve important problems and deliver added value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be the best versions of themselves. We organise various D&amp
column4:
I initiatives, including an active employee-led Employee Resource Group (ERG) community, comprising 9 diversity groups with over 200 PwC employees aiming to make an impact within and beyond PwC.
  • A sustainable mobility offer: we offer a comprehensive mobility budget with a wide range of options (hybrid and electric cars, bike leasing, mobility card or loan reimbursement).
  • Well-being: an extensive health and well-being programme that includes access to professional sport coaching, individual sessions, sports communities and mental health resources. We encourage a healthy lifestyle with regular wellness challenges and various catering options at our cafeteria.
  • Team events such as Last Friday Drinks, quarterly themed parties, team-building days and celebrations, as well as time spent on community days and charity activities.
  • International PwC network: broad access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms.
  • Supporting you in every phase of your life, including family friendly work schemes.

3981852487,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-collibra-3981852487?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=pO4eAgLR2xOFZv7E29gK0Q%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Business Intelligence Analyst,Collibra,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Joining Collibra’s Product Operations team

Collibra brings trust to data and AI through flexible and governed catalog, continuous quality and built-in privacy for the world’s leading brands. Headquartered in New York City and Brussels, Collibra works with 700+ customers worldwide and partners with the most innovative companies. We are on a mission to unite organizations with data that's easy to find, understand, trust and access.

Collibra brings trust to data and AI through flexible and governed catalog, continuous quality and built-in privacy for the world’s leading brands. Headquartered in New York City and Brussels, Collibra works with 700+ customers worldwide and partners with the most innovative companies. We are on a mission to unite organizations with data that's easy to find, understand, trust and access.

The team: Collibra’s Product Operations team works at the intersection of Product, Customer Success, Sales, and Engineering. Our mission is to be a trusted partner, providing processes and information that deliver a better experience and more value to our customers, faster.
The role: We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to analyze our product usage, content, and operational data, and work with stakeholders to drive efficiency, quality, and scale.

You will report to the VP of Product Operations and work primarily with stakeholders across all functions in Product. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with other Business and Data Intelligence Analysts across Collibra to develop a culture of data-driven decision-making.
The BI Analyst at Collibra is responsible for
Working hand-in-hand with subject matter experts to define key metrics and data gathering methodologies for various exciting initiatives, focusing mainly on product, customer, and user analytics.
Designing, developing, and continuously improving useful and user-friendly reporting and analytics solutions.
Creating engaging dashboards and visualizations to showcase key metrics.
Turning complex data findings into clear, actionable recommendations for internal stakeholders and leaders.
2+ years of experience in analytics and reporting, preferably in a SaaS context.
Deep appreciation for data. You understand more than most that good data leads to outcomes, and want to learn with the best.

Experience in data exploration and wrangling. You can interrogate data stored in relational databases with SQL and productionalize data pipelines using tools like dbt. Programming experience with Python and/or Java is a plus.
Experience in data modeling. You operate with an understanding of thoughtful model design, query performance, and code maintainability.
Exposure to SaaS productivity tools. You’ve used or understand the purpose of tools like Jira, Salesforce, Pendo, Centercode, Aha!, Zendesk and Collibra.
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent related working experience is required
A story teller, with experience visualizing data effectively. You can make data tell the story, using business intelligence tools like Tableau, Looker or Power BI.
A builder, creating data products to solve problems and unlock growth.
An excellent communicator. You can present your ideas succinctly and effectively in excellent written and spoken English. Other languages are a plus—our team speaks over seven!
A customer champion, translating usage patterns into product improvements.
A team player, helping us grow our business and growing with it.
First Month: Build relationships within the Product Operations team, understand our product tools, processes, and data landscape, and start supporting existing reporting initiatives.
Third Month: Establish relationships with key SMEs, continuously improve existing reporting initiatives, and start developing your own.
Sixth Month: Successfully roll out your first data product for Product & Engineering.
This position is not eligible for additional commission-based compensation. Salary offers are based on a combination of factors, including, but not limited to, experience, skills, and location.
In addition to base salary, we offer equity ownership at every level, bonus potential, a Flex Fund monthly stipend, pension/401k plans, and more.

Collibra recognizes and values that everyone has different needs, interests, and life goals. We built our {Be}well benefits program with flexibility in mind to support you and your loved ones through a diverse range of circumstances and life events. These flexible offerings sit on a foundation of competitive compensation, health coverage, and time off.

Collibrians are ambitious and inventive, and we want to develop our skills individually and as a team. You’ll have access to development opportunities, as well as other rewards and recognition programs to help grow your career.
We strive to remain locally competitive and globally equitable. This means comprehensive offerings including medical, dental, vision, and mental health benefits for you and your family.

We provide unlimited paid time off, global leave policies for a variety of personal and family circumstances, company-wide wellness days off throughout the year, meeting-free Wednesdays, and a flexible culture to help balance your work and your life.
We create inclusion and belonging through how we onboard, meet, connect, engage, and communicate. Learn more about diversity, equity, and inclusion at Collibra.

At Collibra, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer – which ties directly to our core value, “open, direct, and kind.” We realize the key to creating a company with a world-class culture and employee experience comes from who we hire and creating a workplace that celebrates everyone.

With this, we proudly consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, sex, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, HIV status, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status or any other legally protected category. If you have a need that requires accommodation, let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Joining Collibra’s Product Operations team

Collibra brings trust to data and AI through flexible and governed catalog, continuous quality and built-in privacy for the world’s leading brands. Headquartered in New York City and Brussels, Collibra works with 700+ customers worldwide and partners with the most innovative companies. We are on a mission to unite organizations with data that's easy to find, understand, trust and access.

Collibra brings trust to data and AI through flexible and governed catalog, continuous quality and built-in privacy for the world’s leading brands. Headquartered in New York City and Brussels, Collibra works with 700+ customers worldwide and partners with the most innovative companies. We are on a mission to unite organizations with data that's easy to find, understand, trust and access.

The team: Collibra’s Product Operations team works at the intersection of Product, Customer Success, Sales, and Engineering. Our mission is to be a trusted partner, providing processes and information that deliver a better experience and more value to our customers, faster.

The role: We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to analyze our product usage, content, and operational data, and work with stakeholders to drive efficiency, quality, and scale.

You will report to the VP of Product Operations and work primarily with stakeholders across all functions in Product. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with other Business and Data Intelligence Analysts across Collibra to develop a culture of data-driven decision-making.

The BI Analyst at Collibra is responsible for

  • Working hand-in-hand with subject matter experts to define key metrics and data gathering methodologies for various exciting initiatives, focusing mainly on product, customer, and user analytics.
  • Designing, developing, and continuously improving useful and user-friendly reporting and analytics solutions.
  • Creating engaging dashboards and visualizations to showcase key metrics.
  • Turning complex data findings into clear, actionable recommendations for internal stakeholders and leaders.

You have

  • 2+ years of experience in analytics and reporting, preferably in a SaaS context.
  • Deep appreciation for data. You understand more than most that good data leads to outcomes, and want to learn with the best.
  • Experience in data exploration and wrangling. You can interrogate data stored in relational databases with SQL and productionalize data pipelines using tools like dbt. Programming experience with Python and/or Java is a plus.
  • Experience in data modeling. You operate with an understanding of thoughtful model design, query performance, and code maintainability.
  • Exposure to SaaS productivity tools. You’ve used or understand the purpose of tools like Jira, Salesforce, Pendo, Centercode, Aha!, Zendesk and Collibra.
  • A bachelor’s degree or equivalent related working experience is required

You are

  • A story teller, with experience visualizing data effectively. You can make data tell the story, using business intelligence tools like Tableau, Looker or Power BI.
  • A builder, creating data products to solve problems and unlock growth.
  • An excellent communicator. You can present your ideas succinctly and effectively in excellent written and spoken English. Other languages are a plus—our team speaks over seven!
  • A customer champion, translating usage patterns into product improvements.
  • A team player, helping us grow our business and growing with it.

Measures of success

  • First Month: Build relationships within the Product Operations team, understand our product tools, processes, and data landscape, and start supporting existing reporting initiatives.
  • Third Month: Establish relationships with key SMEs, continuously improve existing reporting initiatives, and start developing your own.
  • Sixth Month: Successfully roll out your first data product for Product &

3975227660,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-sonate-technologie-3975227660?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=piDyrZTwGZvXLZE7ofPXHw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,Sonate technologie,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"On behalf of our client, a leading company in the energy sector, we are looking for an Experienced Data Analyst

Context: Our client is making significant investments in their information system to enhance competitiveness and drive development. The team supports the industrialization of costing processes for customers and the management of exposures related to confirmed sales positions for both gas and power. High-performing forecasting is a key part of these processes.

Mission Objective: To strengthen the team responsible for the delivery and maintenance of tools for various departments, with potential extension to all European countries. The goal is to industrialize and secure business processes by designing and delivering IT solutions (Web API-oriented).
Write functional specifications (PBI, use cases, process design)
Act as the liaison between business and development teams
Assist the business during acceptance testing
Knowledge and skills in the energy market industry
Knowledge of portfolio management or risk management or trading
Demonstrated ability to understand customer requirements and deliver innovative solutions
Strong interpersonal skills with proven ability to interact with a variety of stakeholders, assimilate feedback, and assess impact
Comfortable working in a fast-paced multidisciplinary environment while maintaining strict customer data privacy
Ability to atomize and abstract topics to make them more generic (Experienced, mandatory)
Entrepreneurial spirit and creative approach to problem-solving, especially in digital initiatives

On behalf of our client, a leading company in the energy sector, we are looking for an Experienced Data Analyst


Context: Our client is making significant investments in their information system to enhance competitiveness and drive development. The team supports the industrialization of costing processes for customers and the management of exposures related to confirmed sales positions for both gas and power. High-performing forecasting is a key part of these processes.


Mission Objective: To strengthen the team responsible for the delivery and maintenance of tools for various departments, with potential extension to all European countries. The goal is to industrialize and secure business processes by designing and delivering IT solutions (Web API-oriented).


Main Activities:

  • Write functional specifications (PBI, use cases, process design)
  • Write test cases
  • Perform integration tests
  • Act as the liaison between business and development teams
  • Assist the business during acceptance testing
  • Ensure deliveries and respect deadlines
  • Production monitoring and maintenance


Expected Skills:

  • API / Swagger (mandatory)
  • SQL queries (mandatory)
  • Functional database design/modeling (mandatory)
  • Data warehousing (Medallion Architecture) (mandatory)
  • Python (mandatory)
  • Azure DevOps (TFS or VSTS) (optional)
  • PowerBI (optional)
  • Microsoft Teams (optional)
  • Confluence (optional)
  • Databricks or PySpark (optional)
  • Insomnia / Postman (optional)
  • AWS (optional)


Functional Skills:

  • Experience in data management
  • Knowledge and skills in the energy market industry
  • Knowledge of portfolio management or risk management or trading
  • Knowledge in energy forecasting activities
  • Demonstrated ability to understand customer requirements and deliver innovative solutions
  • Agile methodology


Behavioral Competencies:

  • Strong interpersonal skills with proven ability to interact with a variety of stakeholders, assimilate feedback, and assess impact
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced multidisciplinary environment while maintaining strict customer data privacy
  • Ability to atomize and abstract topics to make them more generic (Experienced, mandatory)
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and creative approach to problem-solving, especially in digital initiatives

3967538977,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-insights-analyst-at-telenet-3967538977?position=10&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=g49PhDapC54OFdDvHD6LdA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data & Insights Analyst,Telenet,"Mechelen, Flemish Region, Belgium","You’ll be part of the Strategy team, working closely with senior management and focusing on the business lines of Telenet, BASE, and Tadaam for both segments: a) residential and b) SOHO (small office home office).
Here are some key points about the role:
Your tasks as a Data & Insights Analyst
Identify & Prioritize Insights: Work with business unit’s facilitators and senior management to determine key insights and reporting needs.
Build & Communicate Dashboards: Create and share KPI dashboards that map business unit’s performance.
Recommend Improvements: Proactively suggest areas for performance enhancement.
Collaborate on Deep Dives: Work with Data & Insights specialists to synthesize complex insights into actionable recommendations.
Monitor Business Planning: Assist with budget and forecast updates, creating insights with business stakeholders.
Support Colleagues: Help business colleagues with self-service tools.
Strategic Department: Gain a broad view of strategic projects and P&Ls.
Personal Development: Opportunities for internal mobility and extensive learning opportunities. Along with chance to press the pause button after a while or take another path.
Work-Life Balance: A supportive environment that adapts to your needs.

Financial incentives: A competitive gross monthly salary that we complement with a lot of fringe benefits (meal vouchers, cell phone, option for a car, hospitalization insurance, telephone subscription, discounts on Telenet products, possibility to work from home,.).
It’s a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you can grow and make a significant impact. Does this role align with what you’re looking for in your next career move?
Minimum 2-3 years' experience as a data or business analyst or similar roles
Master's degree in an economic, technical or economic field (Commercial Engineering, Applied Economics, Computer Science, Digital...) or similar experience
Excellent presentation and storytelling skills. We value different points of view.
Can naturally assume problem solving thinking and has great impact on decision makers
Knowledge and experience in telecom, media or consulting or similar industries is a plus
Fancy a job with content and variety? Become D&I Analyst at Telenet. Apply now!

3966293198,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/bi-data-analyst-at-dexmach-3966293198?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=rRKZlfhYpJq2m%2B7n0asxAw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,BI/Data Analyst,DexMach,"Temse, Flemish Region, Belgium","DexMach is a fast-growing organization with innovative cloud automation solutions. We operate as the Cloud Center of Excellence for the Cegeka Group and are recognized as one (of the only 3) Azure Expert MSP in Belgium. Are you ready to skyrocket your career in the cloud? Join our team as BI/Data Analyst and enjoy a rewarding career in a scale-up with the perks of a large company.
Key overall responsibility is to work with the customer business teams and apply your statistical, analytical and visualization skills. This typically includes the following activities:
Create a trustful relationship with our customers and assist in their data needs
Act as the link between the technical and business roles, translate the information requirements into functional specifications, ensuring all essential data analysis functionalities are embedded
Translate source data and business requirements into conceptual and logical data models that are fit for purpose
Support your business colleagues to increase their self-service insights capabilities via creating intuitive and impactful visualizations.
Create dashboards that are not only pleasing to the eye but also convey accurate and actionable insights effectively
Implement data validation and data quality checks
Commitment to continuous improvement and staying updated with the latest trends and techniques in data visualization.
A natural-born problem solver who takes initiative and is eager to learn
At least 2 years of experience in Power Bi (Power Query, DAX, Power Bi Service)
Strong focus on the visual aspects of dashboards, ensuring clarity, coherence, and aesthetic appeal.
Understanding of best practices in data visualization and design principles.
Strong communication skills, especially to explain complex analytical problems in a clear, precise and actionable manner
Good understanding of data warehousing, data modeling, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with unstructured data and handling various data formats (JSON, CSV, Parquet)
Proficiency in working with APIs to extract and manipulate data
High level of accuracy and attention to detail in data analysis and reporting.

Flexible, collaborative and results driven mindset: enthusiastic to work in a very dynamic & changing environment, committed and business savvy to navigate the potential technical or organizational roadblocks
Team spirit. Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, teach others and learn from your teammates.
Experience in working in an agile organization is a plus
Experience in working in Azure is a plus (e.g. Azure Data Factory, Fabric)
Fluent in English. Knowledge of Dutch is a plus
You must be authorized and eligible to work freely in the EU

DexMach is a fast-growing organization with innovative cloud automation solutions. We are one of the few Microsoft Azure Expert MSP worldwide and proud winner of the Belgium Microsoft Partner of the Year 2021 award. According to our employees, we are a FUN company: your happiness is our concern. Team spirit is key to success, we are #oneteam!
Together with all that we offer you a market-tailored salary package, including extra-legal advantages.

DexMach is a fast-growing organization with innovative cloud automation solutions. We operate as the Cloud Center of Excellence for the Cegeka Group and are recognized as one (of the only 3) Azure Expert MSP in Belgium. Are you ready to skyrocket your career in the cloud? Join our team as BI/Data Analyst and enjoy a rewarding career in a scale-up with the perks of a large company.

3921693172,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-atlas-copco-3921693172?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=PV2mLaUtQR71cu%2BaIq3sgg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,Atlas Copco,"Antwerp, Flemish Region, Belgium","Passionate people create exceptional things
Did you know that the solutions we develop are a key part of most industries? We´re everywhere! Working with us means that you can make an impact towards a sustainable future.
Here, your ideas are embraced, you never stop learning, and you can be part of the solution for a better tomorrow.
Join us and make the difference

The Smart Compressors team in Engineering in Industrial Air enables (remote) control and monitoring, collects insights into the machines and allows them to communicate with its environment, all to turn it into a state-of-the-art smart compressor.
As a member of this team in Engineering in Industrial Air, you will collaborate globally to maximize and expand the potential of data in machines.
You implement, help and (once fully trained) coordinate data-driven tasks for our compressors.
You explore machine data and gain new insights, and you develop new processes that ensure that data provides better visibility into the performance of our current and future compressors.
There will be a wide variety of data tasks in terms of complexity, timeline, and overall data set size.

The goal is to implement your findings into tangible business value, such as: proactively guaranteeing machine uptime, and using data to pitch new functionalities that make our smart compressor even smarter.

You will work within engineering, a diverse group of experts and project engineers, who work together in a family-like atmosphere. You are encouraged to develop yourself, provide valuable input and receive a godmother/-father to help you on your way. You participate in projects that impact our business and ensure the sustainability of our planet.
You have a Master's degree in Computer Science, Data engineering or similar through experience.
You enjoy working with data and have a passion for technology.
You find it important to work with different people and you feel good in a team.
You dare to build new methods and want to improve processes.
You can program with Python, SQL and are familiar with Azure.
You can visualize data with Power BI, or are willing to learn this.
You speak English, Dutch is an added value.
MS Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Word) and other O365 applications have no secrets for you.
You are interested in artificial intelligence and machine learning.
A supportive working environment, within a high performing team.
A satisfying career – We are passionate about the development & progression of our employees.
Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice
Bright ideas come from all of us. We recognize that our long-term success depends on how we behave towards our colleagues, business partners, society and the planet.
Together we build a culture where difference is valued, we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging, and we can be part of the solution for a better tomorrow.

Passionate people create exceptional things

Did you know that the solutions we develop are a key part of most industries? We´re everywhere! Working with us means that you can make an impact towards a sustainable future.
Here, your ideas are embraced, you never stop learning, and you can be part of the solution for a better tomorrow.

Join us and make the difference

Your Role

The Smart Compressors team in Engineering in Industrial Air enables (remote) control and monitoring, collects insights into the machines and allows them to communicate with its environment, all to turn it into a state-of-the-art smart compressor.
As a member of this team in Engineering in Industrial Air, you will collaborate globally to maximize and expand the potential of data in machines.
You implement, help and (once fully trained) coordinate data-driven tasks for our compressors.
You explore machine data and gain new insights, and you develop new processes that ensure that data provides better visibility into the performance of our current and future compressors.
There will be a wide variety of data tasks in terms of complexity, timeline, and overall data set size.
The goal is to implement your findings into tangible business value, such as: proactively guaranteeing machine uptime, and using data to pitch new functionalities that make our smart compressor even smarter.
You will work within engineering, a diverse group of experts and project engineers, who work together in a family-like atmosphere. You are encouraged to develop yourself, provide valuable input and receive a godmother/-father to help you on your way. You participate in projects that impact our business and ensure the sustainability of our planet.

To succeed, you will need

  • You have a Master's degree in Computer Science, Data engineering or similar through experience.
  • You enjoy working with data and have a passion for technology.
  • You find it important to work with different people and you feel good in a team.
  • You dare to build new methods and want to improve processes.
  • You can program with Python, SQL and are familiar with Azure.
  • You can visualize data with Power BI, or are willing to learn this.
  • You speak English, Dutch is an added value.
  • MS Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Word) and other O365 applications have no secrets for you.
  • You are interested in artificial intelligence and machine learning.


In return, we offer you

  • A supportive working environment, within a high performing team.
  • A satisfying career – We are passionate about the development &
column2:
progression of our employees.


Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice

Bright ideas come from all of us. We recognize that our long-term success depends on how we behave towards our colleagues, business partners, society and the planet.
Together we build a culture where difference is valued, we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging, and we can be part of the solution for a better tomorrow.

3968117676,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketing-data-analyst-remote-at-leadtech-group-3968117676?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=PsSb65u0%2FMo9X5fSgdhacg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Marketing Data Analyst (Remote),Leadtech Group,European Union,"We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.
How you will make a difference:
Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team.
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers.
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok.
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes.
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards.
Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Perks of being one of us
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!
You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A little bit about us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:

  • Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
  • Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team.
  • Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets.
  • High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
  • Analysis of product &
column2:
marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers.
  • Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product &
column3:
marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
  • Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok.
  • Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
  • Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.
  • Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes.
  • Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability

    • Requirements

    • Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry.
    • Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques.
    • Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
    • In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
    • Experience working with data visualization tools
    • Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
    • Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
    • Proactive attitude and results-oriented.


    Benefits

    Perks of being one of us

    • Full-time, permanent contract
    • Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
    • Remote work
    • Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
    • Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
    • Enhanced career path designed just for you
    • External training budget
    • We celebrate all company landmarks

    Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.


    Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

    Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

    Location

    You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

    If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

3971249810,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ev-data-analyst-business-intelligence-specialist-h-f-x-at-totalenergies-3971249810?position=16&pageNum=0&refId=bNav70inBwzr8Kp475yb9g%3D%3D&trackingId=i4Xwoxc8gdLn5TIfifF2vQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,EV Data Analyst Business Intelligence Specialist (H/F/X),TotalEnergies,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Profil du candidat
Langues : Français Néerlandais. L'anglais est un plus.
Master académique ou équivalent par l'expérience professionnelle (science des données, statistiques, ingénierie, informatique).
Solide expérience analytique/mathématique avec une grande attention aux détails.

column2: agile et pragmatique.

column1: Solides compétences organisationnelles. Bonne capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois.
Capacité à communiquer clairement des informations sur les données (y compris la capacité à structurer des présentations de gestion).
Ne pas avoir peur de plonger dans les modèles statistiques, la modélisation prédictive, les algorithmes de classification, les arbres de décision, le clustering, etc.
Volonté d'évoluer dans un environnement en constante évolution.
Coordonner la collecte, l'agrégation, le traitement, l'analyse et le support des données :
Construire, exploiter et maintenir la plateforme/environnement Power BI (et sa connexion à l'entrepôt de données de TotalEnergies).
Concevoir et créer des tableaux de bord d'analyse de données et des modèles statistiques pour aider l'équipe EV à gérer les ventes, les opérations, le sourcing, les projets, etc.
Développer des modèles de prévision et d'analyse de localisation pour l'expansion du réseau de recharge (semi)public.
Développer et soutenir l'échange de données vers et depuis les applications/outils EV et les systèmes ERP pertinents (externes).
Agir en tant que contributeur clé de l'équipe Solutions pour les solutions innovantes axées sur les données (par exemple, la recharge intelligente, la maintenance prédictive, etc.)
Agir en tant qu'expert de première ligne en matière d'analyse de données et d'outils pour l'équipe chargée de la recharge des véhicules électriques.
Collecte, agrégation, synthèse et intégration des données externes du marché des VE
Responsable des rapports, du soutien au contrôle de gestion et de la fourniture de données à des tiers :
Fournisseur clé de données sur le réseau de recharge (performance et déploiement) à la direction pour la prise de décisions stratégiques.
Mise en place, suivi et enrichissement des données de performance clés.
Collaborer avec l'équipe des opérations pour identifier les problèmes opérationnels.
Collaborer avec l'équipe de contrôle de gestion pour structurer les résultats à partager avec la direction.
Collaborer avec l'équipe Solutions pour les développements matériels et logiciels.
Assurer la liaison avec les fournisseurs informatiques internes et externes et le département informatique de TotalEnergies sur les projets de données et signaler les déviations et les opportunités.
Suivre et étudier activement les tendances du marché des VE et partager les informations pertinentes avec l'organisation et la direction.

TotalEnergies Charging Solutions Belgium est une filiale essentielle pour soutenir TotalEnergies dans son engagement pour une meilleure énergie. Ce jeune département se développe rapidement pour répondre à l'énorme transition en cours, et est donc en constante évolution. TSCB est donc la recherche d’un.e :
EV Data Analyst Business Intelligence Specialist (H/F/X)

Profil du candidat

  • Langues : Français Néerlandais. L'anglais est un plus.
  • Master académique ou équivalent par l'expérience professionnelle (science des données, statistiques, ingénierie, informatique).
  • Solide expérience analytique/mathématique avec une grande attention aux détails.
  • Expérience en gestion/analyse/science des données.
  • Résolveur de problèmes indépendant
column2:
agile et pragmatique.
  • Solides compétences organisationnelles. Bonne capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois.
  • Capacité à communiquer clairement des informations sur les données (y compris la capacité à structurer des présentations de gestion).
  • Ne pas avoir peur de plonger dans les modèles statistiques, la modélisation prédictive, les algorithmes de classification, les arbres de décision, le clustering, etc.
  • Affinité avec les opérations commerciales.
  • Volonté d'évoluer dans un environnement en constante évolution.


    • Activités

    Coordonner la collecte, l'agrégation, le traitement, l'analyse et le support des données :

    • Construire, exploiter et maintenir la plateforme/environnement Power BI (et sa connexion à l'entrepôt de données de TotalEnergies).
    • Concevoir et créer des tableaux de bord d'analyse de données et des modèles statistiques pour aider l'équipe EV à gérer les ventes, les opérations, le sourcing, les projets, etc.
    • Développer des modèles de prévision et d'analyse de localisation pour l'expansion du réseau de recharge (semi)public.
    • Développer et soutenir l'échange de données vers et depuis les applications/outils EV et les systèmes ERP pertinents (externes).
    • Agir en tant que contributeur clé de l'équipe Solutions pour les solutions innovantes axées sur les données (par exemple, la recharge intelligente, la maintenance prédictive, etc.)
    • Agir en tant qu'expert de première ligne en matière d'analyse de données et d'outils pour l'équipe chargée de la recharge des véhicules électriques.
    • Collecte, agrégation, synthèse et intégration des données externes du marché des VE


    Responsable des rapports, du soutien au contrôle de gestion et de la fourniture de données à des tiers :

    • Fournisseur clé de données sur le réseau de recharge (performance et déploiement) à la direction pour la prise de décisions stratégiques.
    • Mise en place, suivi et enrichissement des données de performance clés.
    • Collaborer avec l'équipe des opérations pour identifier les problèmes opérationnels.
    • Collaborer avec l'équipe de contrôle de gestion pour structurer les résultats à partager avec la direction.
    • Collaborer avec l'équipe Solutions pour les développements matériels et logiciels.
    • Assurer la liaison avec les fournisseurs informatiques internes et externes et le département informatique de TotalEnergies sur les projets de données et signaler les déviations et les opportunités.
    • Suivre et étudier activement les tendances du marché des VE et partager les informations pertinentes avec l'organisation et la direction.


    Contexte et environnement

    TotalEnergies Charging Solutions Belgium est une filiale essentielle pour soutenir TotalEnergies dans son engagement pour une meilleure énergie. Ce jeune département se développe rapidement pour répondre à l'énorme transition en cours, et est donc en constante évolution. TSCB est donc la recherche d’un.e :

    EV Data Analyst Business Intelligence Specialist (H/F/X)
