3976031094,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/financial-and-operational-data-analyst-at-robert-walters-3976031094?position=6&pageNum=7&refId=oD%2BU%2FMm%2F9XOzANXUycqfWQ%3D%3D&trackingId=VOSmoDljJsdlGUTT4sxalA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Financial and Operational Data Analyst,Robert Walters,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Rejoignez une nouvelle équipe en tant que Financial and Operational Data Analyst dans le secteur juridique à Bruxelles. Une PME en pleine croissance dans le secteur juridique recherche un Financial and Operational Data Analyst pour un poste nouvellement créé. Ce rôle dynamique et varié, directement rattaché au Head of Controlling, offre une occasion unique de contribuer à la réussite de l'entreprise.
Vos responsabilités en tant que nouveau Financial and Operational Data Analyst :
Élaborer, préparer et présenter des rapports détaillés à partir du serveur SQL, résumant les résultats des analyses
Concevoir des tableaux de bord financiers destinés aux différentes équipes
Créer des tableaux de bord financiers pour les clients
Analyser des données financières provenant de sources multiples pour identifier des tendances et des modèles
Découvrir des opportunités pour optimiser les processus de reporting financier
Participer aux activités de planification financière, y compris la budgétisation et les prévisions
Gérer et mettre à jour les bases de données utilisées pour les analyses financières
Un diplôme de master est un atout, mais n'est pas exigé
Vous avez au moins 5 ans d'expérience en tant que data analyst ou financial analyst ou business analyst
Vous maîtrisez Excel, Power BI, SQL Server, les macros et la conception de tableaux de bord
Vous avez de l'expérience en Datawarehouse et en BI
Vous possédez une mentalité analytique et de solides compétences en reporting
Vous êtes motivé à améliorer les processus et à révolutionner la manière de rapporter les données à la direction
Vous avez une forte capacité d'adaptation et de multitâche
Vous parlez couramment le français et l'anglais (le néerlandais est un plus)
Un package salarial attractif incluant une voiture de société, une carte carburant et une assurance hospitalisation
Un accès facile aux transports en commun
Des horaires de travail flexibles et du télétravail

Devenez Financial and Operational Data Analyst dans une structure plate et dynamique, entouré de collègues enthousiastes. Si vous êtes prêt à relever ce défi passionnant dans une PME en pleine croissance, postulez dès maintenant pour faire partie de cette aventure stimulante.
Ce n'est pas le poste que vous recherchez? Peut-être connaissez-vous quelqu'un dans votre réseau qui pourrait être intéressé. Recommandez-lui Robert Walters et vous serez récompensé.

Rejoignez une nouvelle équipe en tant que Financial and Operational Data Analyst dans le secteur juridique à Bruxelles. Une PME en pleine croissance dans le secteur juridique recherche un Financial and Operational Data Analyst pour un poste nouvellement créé. Ce rôle dynamique et varié, directement rattaché au Head of Controlling, offre une occasion unique de contribuer à la réussite de l'entreprise.

Vos responsabilités en tant que nouveau Financial and Operational Data Analyst :

  • Élaborer, préparer et présenter des rapports détaillés à partir du serveur SQL, résumant les résultats des analyses
  • Concevoir des tableaux de bord financiers destinés aux différentes équipes
  • Créer des tableaux de bord financiers pour les clients
  • Analyser des données financières provenant de sources multiples pour identifier des tendances et des modèles
  • Découvrir des opportunités pour optimiser les processus de reporting financier
  • Participer aux activités de planification financière, y compris la budgétisation et les prévisions
  • Gérer et mettre à jour les bases de données utilisées pour les analyses financières

À Propos De Vous

  • Un diplôme de master est un atout, mais n'est pas exigé
  • Vous avez au moins 5 ans d'expérience en tant que data analyst ou financial analyst ou business analyst
  • Vous maîtrisez Excel, Power BI, SQL Server, les macros et la conception de tableaux de bord
  • Vous avez de l'expérience en Datawarehouse et en BI
  • Vous possédez une mentalité analytique et de solides compétences en reporting
  • Vous êtes motivé à améliorer les processus et à révolutionner la manière de rapporter les données à la direction
  • Vous avez une forte capacité d'adaptation et de multitâche
  • Vous parlez couramment le français et l'anglais (le néerlandais est un plus)

L'offre Qu’on Vous Propose

  • Un package salarial attractif incluant une voiture de société, une carte carburant et une assurance hospitalisation
  • Une indemnité nette
  • Un accès facile aux transports en commun
  • Des opportunités de développement
  • Des horaires de travail flexibles et du télétravail

Devenez Financial and Operational Data Analyst dans une structure plate et dynamique, entouré de collègues enthousiastes. Si vous êtes prêt à relever ce défi passionnant dans une PME en pleine croissance, postulez dès maintenant pour faire partie de cette aventure stimulante.

Ce n'est pas le poste que vous recherchez? Peut-être connaissez-vous quelqu'un dans votre réseau qui pourrait être intéressé. Recommandez-lui Robert Walters et vous serez récompensé.

3981387068,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-technical-support-analyst-trilogy-remote-%2460-000-year-usd-at-crossover-3981387068?position=7&pageNum=7&refId=oD%2BU%2FMm%2F9XOzANXUycqfWQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Otnydocui0vg4JJ4NI1sZg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,"Senior Technical Support Analyst, Trilogy (Remote) - $60,000/year USD",Crossover,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?

In the fast-paced world of enterprise software, traditional customer support methods often fall short of excellence. Support engineers often find themselves bogged down in repetitive troubleshooting, limited by the narrow scope of their product expertise. Data shows that over 60% of support tickets are escalated due to inadequate problem-solving skills or a lack of product knowledge. This not only frustrates customers but also stifles the growth and satisfaction of support agents.

At Trilogy, we’ve reimagined customer support with the power of AI. Managing over 100 unique enterprise software products, we leverage advanced AI tools to streamline troubleshooting and enhance problem-solving capabilities. Our AI-driven approach not only helps diagnose issues faster but also provides intelligent insights and solutions, making our support team exceptionally efficient and effective. Our AI-powered chatbot crushes most tickets, so only the most complicated customer issues will be escalated to you.

The issues you face in this role will be challenging and diverse, requiring solutions that may involve configuration, database adjustments, or even code-level fixes. This is not a role for those who prefer to stick to familiar routines or spend months mastering a single product. We seek self-starters who can quickly adapt, troubleshoot efficiently, and continuously learn on the job. If you are someone who gets frustrated by rigid processes or needs extensive hand-holding, this is not the right fit for you.

You will be a crucial part of the Trilogy Support team, directly contributing to our reputation for exceptional customer service. This position offers a unique opportunity to advance your career rapidly by developing deep technical expertise across a wide array of products. If you are ready to embrace a challenging yet rewarding role where you can make a significant impact, we encourage you to apply.
AI-Augmented Customer Resolutions: Analyze complex tickets escalated by AI systems, apply human expertise to areas where AI falls short, and then close the gap by improving the AI system
AI Training and Improvement: Review AI-generated solutions and provide detailed feedback and participate in AI model fine-tuning sessions
Cutting-Edge AI Integration: Prototype and test new AI tools and methodologies
Taking two whole months to get up to speed
column2: you will be expected to ramp up one several products within the first month (we are aware this is aggressive)

column1: Relying on your managers for help
column2: if you are not adept at unblocking yourself, you will likely struggle in this role

column1: Senior Technical Support Analyst Key Responsibilities
Integrate technical human expertise and AI capabilities to deliver exceptional customer support, focusing on complex issues that AI cannot yet fully resolve
At least 4 total years of experience in a technical customer support or engineering role
While this is NOT a coding-heavy role, you will still need to be able to read and write code at a basic level for debugging purposes
Experience using generative AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Bing, Claude, Bard) in a professional setting

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us:
First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.

Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Senior Technical Support Analyst Key Responsibilities

Basic Requirements

Working with Crossover

3979586741,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ormit-talent-data-traineeship-at-ormit-talent-belgium-3979586741?position=8&pageNum=7&refId=oD%2BU%2FMm%2F9XOzANXUycqfWQ%3D%3D&trackingId=YwvwLGK97%2Fj79oDvxEb6Ww%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Ormit Talent - Data Traineeship,Ormit Talent Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Always had a thing for data? Time for the next step then. And go from curious data lover to curious data chief. In various roles at one or more companies. As a data analyst, data translator, business analyst, junior data scientist, ...
Because data is the new gold. If you know how to turn them into insights. That’s why more and more companies are investing in data. And in people who know how to handle them.
How special are you? Do the test.
You say oui and ja. You speak fluently French or Dutch. With a B1 level for the other.
A big passion for data is a big must. You don't need to be an expert in data just yet. We’ll help you become one. Just show us your affinity and above all: your passion!
Data tools are your middle name. Excel has no secrets for you, and other tools like Python, SQL or PowerBI sound familiar too. You just love to dive into all possible data tools.
You have a master or bachelor degree in a data-oriented field. Think civil or business engineering, mathematics, computer science, applied economics, statistics, IT,…
Or max 3 years work experience in analytics or a job filled with projects that triggered your passion for data, digital and tech.
You are curious (relentlessly). You want to know everything about as many things as possible. And if you don’t know it, you want to learn it. Comfort zones are a joke to you.
What’s in it for you? A killer combo of data and people skills
Discover your data thing: Find out which part you want to play in the data universe (and at which company). By doing and learning. And with our help.
Challenging projects: Switch roles, teams, companies and industries. In advanced data analytics, processing, project management, business analytics, … The common thread: data.
Boost your skills: Get ready to be amused and amazed with +20 tailored training days on data and people skills. Where you learn how to translate data into business reality.
Learn from senior experts: Who support and coach you during your assignments. And gladly share their knowledge on data and people skills with you.
Build connections : All those teams and companies, no wonder you’re left with a tremendous network. Not to mention your fellow special ones (and BFF’s).
Land in your dream job: Is there life after this traineeship? Absolutely! As a future proof data expert. And who knows, maybe even chief data officer ...
Enjoy the ride: Be part of a tight group of special ones. Instantly. Who you bond with for years to come. Thanks to our many events, workshops or during running.
How to become a data chief?
Discover in trainings how data skills (advanced analytics, functional analysis, visualisation, …) and people skills (communication, self-leadership, …) form a killer combo in your everyday work.
Work in data analytics, data management, data processing, business analytics, project management, data science, …
And then grow even further thanks to personal coaching and data mentoring
We bet you still have a lot of questions or could use our help. Tell us who you are and what you're looking for. One of our recruiters will get in touch.

Always had a thing for data? Time for the next step then. And go from curious data lover to curious data chief. In various roles at one or more companies. As a data analyst, data translator, business analyst, junior data scientist, ...


Because data is the new gold. If you know how to turn them into insights. That’s why more and more companies are investing in data. And in people who know how to handle them.



How special are you? Do the test.

  • You say oui and ja. You speak fluently French or Dutch. With a B1 level for the other.
  • A big passion for data is a big must. You don't need to be an expert in data just yet. We’ll help you become one. Just show us your affinity and above all: your passion!
  • Data tools are your middle name. Excel has no secrets for you, and other tools like Python, SQL or PowerBI sound familiar too. You just love to dive into all possible data tools.
  • You have a master or bachelor degree in a data-oriented field. Think civil or business engineering, mathematics, computer science, applied economics, statistics, IT,…
  • Or max 3 years work experience in analytics or a job filled with projects that triggered your passion for data, digital and tech.
  • You are curious (relentlessly). You want to know everything about as many things as possible. And if you don’t know it, you want to learn it. Comfort zones are a joke to you.



What’s in it for you? A killer combo of data and people skills

  • Discover your data thing: Find out which part you want to play in the data universe (and at which company). By doing and learning. And with our help.
  • Challenging projects: Switch roles, teams, companies and industries. In advanced data analytics, processing, project management, business analytics, … The common thread: data.
  • Boost your skills: Get ready to be amused and amazed with +20 tailored training days on data and people skills. Where you learn how to translate data into business reality.
  • Learn from senior experts: Who support and coach you during your assignments. And gladly share their knowledge on data and people skills with you.
  • Build connections : All those teams and companies, no wonder you’re left with a tremendous network. Not to mention your fellow special ones (and BFF’s).
  • Land in your dream job: Is there life after this traineeship? Absolutely! As a future proof data expert. And who knows, maybe even chief data officer ...
  • Enjoy the ride: Be part of a tight group of special ones. Instantly. Who you bond with for years to come. Thanks to our many events, workshops or during running.



How to become a data chief?

  • Discover in trainings how data skills (advanced analytics, functional analysis, visualisation, …) and people skills (communication, self-leadership, …) form a killer combo in your everyday work.
  • Work in data analytics, data management, data processing, business analytics, project management, data science, …
  • And then grow even further thanks to personal coaching and data mentoring



Ask us!

We bet you still have a lot of questions or could use our help. Tell us who you are and what you're looking for. One of our recruiters will get in touch.

Contact our recruiters : recruitment@ormittalent.be

3974888209,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-business-analyst-expert-in-power-bi-at-kcs-it-3974888209?position=9&pageNum=7&refId=oD%2BU%2FMm%2F9XOzANXUycqfWQ%3D%3D&trackingId=%2Be8nSQIH8L%2FFmcP73e%2FpDA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,"Senior Business Analyst, Expert in Power BI",KCS iT,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Founded in 2005 in Lisbon by three visionary entrepreneurs, MoOngy quickly became a leading group in Engineering and Information Technology (IT) across Europe and North Africa. Today, with a presence in 14 countries and more than 40 subsidiary companies, MoOngy employs over 9,500 talents who share a common passion for innovation and excellence.

The International Mobility Recruitment Department is dedicated to enhancing the mobility of IT professionals throughout Europe, facilitating the placement of talents in the various markets where it operates.
Position: Senior Business Analyst, Expert in Power BI
You are ready to work on global projects and contribute to digital transformation across various industries
You wish to expand your career beyond national borders and you are ready for an European adventure
You want to be part of a global community of innovators.

Technical and Soft Skills: As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing complex business problems and translating them into actionable insights using the Power BI platform. You will work closely with various stakeholders to gather requirements, design and develop reports and dashboards, and provide data-driven recommendations to drive business growth and efficiency.
Bachelor's degree i Administration, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst, with a strong focus on data analysis and visualization using Power BI.
Proven experience in Power BI architecture and development, including the ability to design and develop complex data models, reports, dashboards, and interactive visuals.
Proficiency in writing DAX queries and utilizing advanced features in Power BI.
Solid understanding of data integration techniques, including ETL processes and data modeling.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to transform business requirements into actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Fluent in English (C2 level) and is a plus a proficient in Dutch or French (B2 level) is mandatory
Candidates must be in Europe already
Design and develop Power BI reports and dashboards that provide clear, concise, and actionable information to support business decision-making.
Build and maintain data models and data integration workflows in Power BI to ensure accuracy and consistency of data.
Collaborate with data engineers and database administrators to optimize data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Perform data cleansing and validation to ensure data quality and integrity.
Continuously monitor and analyze data trends, identifying areas of improvement and making recommendations for process enhancement.
International Mobility: Access to a dedicated international mobility department with personalized relocation programs to facilitate your move to a new country.
Career Development: Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies in different countries and various sectors.
Continuous Learning: Access to ongoing and free training and career-oriented certifications.
Personal Growth: Exchange of ideas and best practices among professionals across Europe, fostering creativity and innovation in IT.
Global Citizen in the World of Technology: Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.

@MoOngy Group we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills needed for the position are welcome!

3951969557,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-statistician-at-eortc-european-organisation-for-research-and-treatment-of-cancer-3951969557?position=3&pageNum=10&refId=pNssED8YdJGOm49lPazXsw%3D%3D&trackingId=qaBd3cXbUfedvYVD5Tc9Cw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Senior Statistician,EORTC - European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Senior Statistician

The Senior Statistician supports the statistical activities for one or several EORTC Groups or Task Forces and/or identified EORTC transversal projects. The Senior Statistician works under the hierarchical supervision of the Head of Statistics Department.

The Senior statistician complies with EORTC standard operating procedures and other international guidelines in use at EORTC. He/she is also responsible to safeguard the compliance of his/her collaborators with the EORTC Policies and principles of conduct.
The senior statistician may be helped in his/her tasks by statistical fellows and/or statistical analysts and/or statisticians.
Responsibilities in studies and research projects
The senior statistician is accountable for the development, the conduct, analysis and reporting of his/her studies and research projects, as detailed in the Standard Operating Procedures, including
Development of case report forms and any activities required for the set-up of a study in collaboration with other departments
Communication with the EORTC Independent Data Monitoring Committee Support Unit
Supporting the medical staff in the interpretation and framing of results
Preparation of material for presentation of results to conferences
Submission of clinical trial results to regulators (EudraCT, clinicaltrials.gov)
Actively participates to the bi-weekly meetings of the statistics department and to the internal protocol review meetings
Ensures the up-to-date knowledge of the statistical techniques necessary for the proper design and the analysis of clinical trials
Gives lectures during educational sessions or courses organized by or with EORTC
May train and oversee the activities of fellow statisticians
Write and maintain Work Instructions and/or Standard Operating Procedures

The position is open for candidates with an MSc, PhD or ScD degree in biostatistics or statistics with at least 5 years of experience in clinical trials research (preferably oncology). In addition, the position requires:
Experience in the design of (preferably oncology) clinical trials and in survival analysis is mandatory
Proficiency in the use of SAS
column2: experience with R is an asset

column1: Knowledge in health-related quality of life and/or health technology assessment is an asset
Good communication skills in both oral and written English
Ability to work in an international multidisciplinary environment
Capable of presenting and debating projects with partners
Dynamic and capable of working autonomously
Motivated by the mission of EORTC
Wage according to our Non-Profit organisation status

Senior Statistician

The Senior Statistician supports the statistical activities for one or several EORTC Groups or Task Forces and/or identified EORTC transversal projects. The Senior Statistician works under the hierarchical supervision of the Head of Statistics Department.


The Senior statistician complies with EORTC standard operating procedures and other international guidelines in use at EORTC. He/she is also responsible to safeguard the compliance of his/her collaborators with the EORTC Policies and principles of conduct.


The senior statistician may be helped in his/her tasks by statistical fellows and/or statistical analysts and/or statisticians.


Main responsibilities / Major Activities


Responsibilities in studies and research projects


The senior statistician is accountable for the development, the conduct, analysis and reporting of his/her studies and research projects, as detailed in the Standard Operating Procedures, including


  • Development of study design
  • Development and review of protocols
  • Development of case report forms and any activities required for the set-up of a study in collaboration with other departments
  • Development of statistical analysis plans
  • Communication with the EORTC Independent Data Monitoring Committee Support Unit
  • Programming and reporting of studies
  • Supporting the medical staff in the interpretation and framing of results
  • Writing sections of manuscripts
  • Review of manuscripts
  • Preparation of material for presentation of results to conferences
  • Submission of clinical trial results to regulators (EudraCT, clinicaltrials.gov)


Responsibilities in the statistics department


  • Actively participates to the bi-weekly meetings of the statistics department and to the internal protocol review meetings
  • Ensures the up-to-date knowledge of the statistical techniques necessary for the proper design and the analysis of clinical trials
  • Gives lectures during educational sessions or courses organized by or with EORTC
  • May train and oversee the activities of fellow statisticians
  • Write and maintain Work Instructions and/or Standard Operating Procedures


Profile

The position is open for candidates with an MSc, PhD or ScD degree in biostatistics or statistics with at least 5 years of experience in clinical trials research (preferably oncology). In addition, the position requires:

  • Experience in the design of (preferably oncology) clinical trials and in survival analysis is mandatory
  • Proficiency in the use of SAS
column2:
experience with R is an asset
  • Experience with CDISC/ADAM
  • Knowledge in health-related quality of life and/or health technology assessment is an asset
  • Good communication skills in both oral and written English
  • Ability to work in an international multidisciplinary environment
  • Capable of presenting and debating projects with partners
  • Able to write scientific communications
  • Dynamic and capable of working autonomously
  • Team player
  • Motivated by the mission of EORTC


    • Benefits

    • Permanent contract
    • Wage according to our Non-Profit organisation status
    • Hybrid working environment (from Belgium)
    • 30 days holidays (full time)
    • Meal vouchers
    • Pension plan
    • Hospitalisation insurance and ambulatory care
    • Homeworking allowance
    • Reimbursement of public transport
    • Free parking

3958929871,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-system-engineer-at-solidaris-vlaanderen-3958929871?position=4&pageNum=10&refId=pNssED8YdJGOm49lPazXsw%3D%3D&trackingId=3NxA5q3L6I%2BBYuGk6wo%2BzQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Junior System Engineer,Solidaris Vlaanderen,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Je functie
Je maakt deel uit van het Infrastructuur team: Distributed & Network
Je beheert IT-systemen en -infrastructuur, controleert kwaliteitsnormen en beheert databases.
Je maakt deel uit van het derdelijns supportteam dat tot doel heeft jouw medewerkers en IT-collega's te helpen bij het gebruik van de gehele infrastructuur (netwerk, servers en applicaties).
Je test, valideert en implementeert wijzigingen in de systemen, voert updates uit en documenteert deze.
Je zult in staat zijn om je taken zowel in teamverband als zelfstandig uit te voeren.
Nacht- en weekenddiensten met het team zijn eveneens vereist.
Je hebt een bachelor in informatica behaald of heb gelijkwaardige relevante ervaring.
Je bent oplossingsgericht, communicatief, stressbestendig, flexibel en beschikt over een goede teamspirit.
Je hebt kennis van of een certificaat behaald op één, maar bij voorkeur op meerdere, van volgende domeinen:
Je hebt een verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel en bent in staat om initiatief te nemen
Je toont flexibiliteit wanneer de werkdruk dit rechtvaardigt
Je bent proactief, hebt zin voor initiatief en weet de juiste prioriteiten te stellen.
Je hebt een basiskennis van ITIL
Je werkt onder de supervisie van de Teamlead Distributed & Network en van de Infrastructuur manager.
Je spreekt vloeiend Frans of Nederlands met een passieve kennis van de tweede taal, kennis van het Engels is een extra troef.

De informatica-afdeling van Solidaris Nationaal Verbond van Socialistische mutualiteiten bestaat uit een 200-tal IT-ers die toepassingen ontwikkelen voor alle aangesloten ziekenfondsen, hun loketten (800) en binnendiensten, verspreid over heel België. Deze toepassingen worden gebruikt door meer dan 3500 personen en maken dagelijks ongeveer 4 miljoen transacties mogelijk.
Betekenisvol werk: Je draagt bij aan het verbeteren van de gezondheid en het welzijn van mensen. Je kunt trots zijn op het feit dat je een positieve impact hebt op het leven van anderen.

Professionele ontwikkeling: Wij bieden een stimulerende omgeving waarin je je professioneel kunt ontwikkelen. Er zijn tal van mogelijkheden voor training, vorming en loopbaangroei, zodat je je vaardigheden voortdurend kunt verbeteren en je carrière kunt laten evolueren.

Flexibiliteit en balans: Wij begrijpen het belang van een gezonde balans tussen werk en privéleven. Een 36 uren werkweek met vrije namiddag, 6 adv-dagen, extra legale verlofdagen die meegroeien met jouw anciënniteit, glijdende werkuren en mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk bieden een omgeving die rekening houdt met jouw behoeften.

Uitgebreide voordelen: Naast het salarispakket zijn er diverse extra-legale voordelen, waaronder maaltijdcheques, groepsverzekering, vergoeding van woon/werkverkeer (aan tarief openbaar vervoer), een hospitalisatieverzekering, mogelijkheid tot fietsleasing en verschillende personeelskortingen.
Samenwerking en teamgeest: Er heerst een sterke teamgeest en er zijn regelmatig activiteiten en evenementen om de onderlinge band te versterken.

Op basis van je motivatiebrief en CV gebeurt een eerste selectie. Zo krijg je meteen antwoord en plannen we eventueel een gesprek in. Van zodra wij de geschikte kandidaat vinden sluiten wij de vacature af.
Solliciteren doe je via de sollicitatieknop. Voeg zeker ook je cv en motivatiebrief toe.
Voor bijkomende inlichtingen over de functie contacteer je Laurent Lauvax, teamleader IT distributed & network (Laurent.Lauvaux@solidaris.be)
Voor algemene informatie over Solidaris ga je naar www.solidaris-vlaanderen.be. Volg ons ook op LinkedIn en Twitter.
Wij moedigen iedereen aan om te solliciteren. Kwaliteiten en competenties zijn belangrijker dan afkomst, leeftijd, geslacht of arbeidshandicap.

Je functie

  • Je maakt deel uit van het Infrastructuur team: Distributed &

3980198118,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-engineer-at-salt-3980198118?position=6&pageNum=10&refId=pNssED8YdJGOm49lPazXsw%3D%3D&trackingId=nIwx4F4lRFtT%2FGz9dIARCQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Senior Data Engineer,Salt,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Senior Data Engineer (ETL,ELT) – Banking – Brussels

My banking client is looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join on a freelance mission. They want someone who can you autonomously craft, develop and deploy data pipelines, making sure these pipelines are filled with qualitative data which serve as an input for our machine learning engineers.

In this role, You collaborate closely with our machine learning engineers and/or cloud architects on projects, always with a quality focused, end-to-end approach. You will support the reporting teams in the data exploration and data preparation phases, Implement data quality controls. You will liaise with IT infrastructure teams to address infrastructure issues and to ensure that the components and software used on our different platforms are all consistent.
As a senior Data engineer you will also build and share knowledge with your junior colleagues.
Candidates must be based in either Belgium, France, The Netherlands or the UK.

Experience with analysis and creation of data pipelines, data architecture, ETL/ELT development and with processing structured and unstructured data, including post-go live activities Ability to analyse data, identify issues (e.g. gaps, inconsistencies) and you can solve them
Experience using data stored in RDBMSs and experience or some understanding of NoSQL databases
You have knowledge of Scala and Spark, and a good understanding of the Hadoop ecosystem including Hadoop file formats like Parquet and ORC
You can write performant Scala code and SQL statements and can design modular, future proof solutions that are fit for purpose
You are autonomous in working on IBM Mainframe & Unix based systems.
You have a true agile approach, capable and willing to tackle tasks outside of their strengths to help the team
Experience in working with customers to identify and clarify requirements
Strong curiosity about FINTECH and technologies related data.
You speak English fluently, any other language is a plus!

Senior Data Engineer (ETL,ELT) – Banking – Brussels

Day rate: €600 - €800

Duration: 12 months

Start: ASAP


My banking client is looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join on a freelance mission. They want someone who can you autonomously craft, develop and deploy data pipelines, making sure these pipelines are filled with qualitative data which serve as an input for our machine learning engineers.

In this role, You collaborate closely with our machine learning engineers and/or cloud architects on projects, always with a quality focused, end-to-end approach. You will support the reporting teams in the data exploration and data preparation phases, Implement data quality controls. You will liaise with IT infrastructure teams to address infrastructure issues and to ensure that the components and software used on our different platforms are all consistent.

As a senior Data engineer you will also build and share knowledge with your junior colleagues.


Job requirements

Candidates must be based in either Belgium, France, The Netherlands or the UK.


The Skills

  • Experience with analysis and creation of data pipelines, data architecture, ETL/ELT development and with processing structured and unstructured data, including post-go live activities Ability to analyse data, identify issues (e.g. gaps, inconsistencies) and you can solve them
  • Experience using data stored in RDBMSs and experience or some understanding of NoSQL databases
  • You have knowledge of Scala and Spark, and a good understanding of the Hadoop ecosystem including Hadoop file formats like Parquet and ORC
  • You can write performant Scala code and SQL statements and can design modular, future proof solutions that are fit for purpose
  • You are autonomous in working on IBM Mainframe &
column2:
Unix based systems.
  • You have a true agile approach, capable and willing to tackle tasks outside of their strengths to help the team
  • Experience in working with customers to identify and clarify requirements
  • Strong curiosity about FINTECH and technologies related data.
  • You have good communication skills!


    • Nice to haves

    • Knowledge of Cloudera, IBM mainframe
    • You speak English fluently, any other language is a plus!

3961513274,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/functional-analyst-at-innova-solutions-3961513274?position=7&pageNum=10&refId=pNssED8YdJGOm49lPazXsw%3D%3D&trackingId=%2B73R2ET%2FfsywDOdB5NhnEA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Functional Analyst,Innova Solutions,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","💼Job Title: IT Functional analyst
🔥Keywords: IT Functional analyst, API Services, IT System, integration and assembly testing

Sector: Our client is a prominent player in the financial sector, recognized for its comprehensive range of banking and financial services. With a global presence, it serves a diverse clientele, including individuals, corporations, and institutions. Emphasizing innovation and customer-centricity, it leverages advanced technologies to deliver tailored solutions that meet the evolving needs of its stakeholders.

The Functional Analyst clearly identifies the problems that the business are experiencing and/or the business requirements and maps out possible solutions that can be developed and integrated in the enterprise production environment. The Functional Analyst investigates costs and benefits. The Functional Analyst consequently designs the chosen solution in detail, defining exactly what it should look like, which data are involved, and which processes are supported.
Functional and technical knowledge of existing IT systems. Creation of swagger files and Creation of API services

Accompany the business analyst and client through the reflection towards a solution – propose alternative and adequate solutions in line with enterprise architecture and strategy and considering cost/benefit.
Ensure that the client understands and adopts enterprise rules and standards concerning architectural standards, security, …
Work together with the architects to set up the architecture
Close collaboration with project manager / asset manager / product owner

Relay between the client, business analyst and involved asset teams, coordination of the involved asset teams (unified view towards the client – ensure that all involved IT parties clearly understand the client needs)
Functional elaboration of the chosen solution alternative, translation of the business requirements in detailed functional requirements
Align with involved assets on the functional responsibilities each asset will need to implement
Application design of the solution, identifying and detailing the impacts on the different application components as specified in the architecture
Align with the different technical teams of the asset to specify each of their requirements
Follow-up of development and testing to ensure coherence between the functional specifications and the developed solution
Provide the technical definitions of components that are supported by different teams (queues, security, integration layers, …)
Support suppliers during the development and integration and assembly testing (I&AT) Analyze defects during test phase
Support the release and deployment teams in the different environments
thirst for knowledge: Agile is about learning and adapting. Knowledge sharing is key to success.

The goal of team success: Agile is about the success of the team, no individual success or heroic behavior. It is more important for the team to succeed than for the individual to have completed his/her tasks.
There is no failure, only feedback: Agile is about taking everything as lessons, adjusting actions based on the feedback, resulting in continuous improvement.

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.
Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.
Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards
Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

💼Job Title: IT Functional analyst

👨‍💻Job Type: Contract

👨‍💻Who can apply: Freelancers

📍Location: Brussels Belgium

📍Language: English and French

💼Work regime: Hybrid (2 days/week onsite)

🔥Keywords: IT Functional analyst, API Services, IT System, integration and assembly testing


Sector: Our client is a prominent player in the financial sector, recognized for its comprehensive range of banking and financial services. With a global presence, it serves a diverse clientele, including individuals, corporations, and institutions. Emphasizing innovation and customer-centricity, it leverages advanced technologies to deliver tailored solutions that meet the evolving needs of its stakeholders.


Position Overview:

The Functional Analyst clearly identifies the problems that the business are experiencing and/or the business requirements and maps out possible solutions that can be developed and integrated in the enterprise production environment. The Functional Analyst investigates costs and benefits. The Functional Analyst consequently designs the chosen solution in detail, defining exactly what it should look like, which data are involved, and which processes are supported.


What you'll do:

Functional and technical knowledge of existing IT systems. Creation of swagger files and Creation of API services

Accompany the business analyst and client through the reflection towards a solution – propose alternative and adequate solutions in line with enterprise architecture and strategy and considering cost/benefit.

Ensure that the client understands and adopts enterprise rules and standards concerning architectural standards, security, …

Work together with the architects to set up the architecture

Close collaboration with project manager / asset manager / product owner

Relay between the client, business analyst and involved asset teams, coordination of the involved asset teams (unified view towards the client – ensure that all involved IT parties clearly understand the client needs)

Functional elaboration of the chosen solution alternative, translation of the business requirements in detailed functional requirements

Align with involved assets on the functional responsibilities each asset will need to implement

Application design of the solution, identifying and detailing the impacts on the different application components as specified in the architecture

Align with the different technical teams of the asset to specify each of their requirements

Follow-up of development and testing to ensure coherence between the functional specifications and the developed solution

Provide the technical definitions of components that are supported by different teams (queues, security, integration layers, …)

Support suppliers during the development and integration and assembly testing (I&
column2:
AT) Analyze defects during test phase

Support the release and deployment teams in the different environments


What you bring:

A positive attitude and pragmatism

thirst for knowledge: Agile is about learning and adapting. Knowledge sharing is key to success.

The goal of team success: Agile is about the success of the team, no individual success or heroic behavior. It is more important for the team to succeed than for the individual to have completed his/her tasks.

There is no failure, only feedback: Agile is about taking everything as lessons, adjusting actions based on the feedback, resulting in continuous improvement.


A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

  1. Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
  2. Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
  3. Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
  4. Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
  5. Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

  1. Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women &
column3:
Millennials, 2024
  • Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
  • American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
  • Global Health &
column4:

  • Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards

3967035661,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-metals-at-ecoinvent-3967035661?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=FDshgkomkk4Y9ahjkpIVhQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst - Metals,ecoinvent,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Description: Data Analyst – Metals Sector

We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.
Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage, including:
Desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and providing analyses to the sector manager.
Reviewing datasets for data provision projects.
Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mining, Metallurgy, or a related field a must.
Preferably a minimum of one year of industry experience in mining, metal processing, or a related field
Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.

column2: any other language is an asset.

column1: Basic programming skills, especially in Python.
Self-motivated attitude, systematic thinking, and strong attention to detail.

The ideal candidate brings strong critical thinking skills and a problem-solving attitude. You are proactive, structured, and organized. You are enthusiastic about learning and pushing for innovation. You will work independently and alongside internal and external collaborators, so good interpersonal skills, effective communication skills, and a can-do attitude are essential. Managing multiple, diverse tasks simultaneously does not phase you. You enjoy working in a diverse and international team, have a curious mind, and grasp new concepts quickly.

As a fast-growing team based in Zürich with over twenty nationalities, we embrace diversity and promote a collaborative and adventurous mindset. We are committed to building an inspiring work culture that nurtures creative thinking, transparency, and reliability.

Our benefits include flexible and hybrid work, employee professional growth plans, and our most vital asset: our community. We value transparency, flexibility, and a diverse working environment that encourages learning and continuous improvement. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do. Join us and make an impact.

ecoinvent is an internationally active, mission-driven organization devoted to supporting high-quality, science-based environmental assessments. Its activities include publishing and maintaining the ecoinvent database—a comprehensive life cycle inventory database that provides reliable and transparent information on the environmental impacts of various products and services. It is used by companies, researchers, and policymakers to analyze the environmental impacts of their operations and make informed decisions.
Please submit your complete application through our LinkedIn posting, including your CV and possible start date.
Please note that immigration sponsorship is not possible for this role.

Job Description: Data Analyst – Metals Sector


We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.


Responsibilities:

  • Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage, including:

Desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and providing analyses to the sector manager.

Reviewing datasets for data provision projects.

  • Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
  • Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mining, Metallurgy, or a related field a must.
  • Preferably a minimum of one year of industry experience in mining, metal processing, or a related field
  • Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.
  • Proficiency in English
column2:
any other language is an asset.
  • Proficiency in MS Office.
  • Basic programming skills, especially in Python.
  • Basic modeling skills.
  • Self-motivated attitude, systematic thinking, and strong attention to detail.

    • The ideal candidate brings strong critical thinking skills and a problem-solving attitude. You are proactive, structured, and organized. You are enthusiastic about learning and pushing for innovation. You will work independently and alongside internal and external collaborators, so good interpersonal skills, effective communication skills, and a can-do attitude are essential. Managing multiple, diverse tasks simultaneously does not phase you. You enjoy working in a diverse and international team, have a curious mind, and grasp new concepts quickly.


    Why ecoinvent?

    As a fast-growing team based in Zürich with over twenty nationalities, we embrace diversity and promote a collaborative and adventurous mindset. We are committed to building an inspiring work culture that nurtures creative thinking, transparency, and reliability.


    Our benefits include flexible and hybrid work, employee professional growth plans, and our most vital asset: our community. We value transparency, flexibility, and a diverse working environment that encourages learning and continuous improvement. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do. Join us and make an impact.


    Our Mission

    ecoinvent is an internationally active, mission-driven organization devoted to supporting high-quality, science-based environmental assessments. Its activities include publishing and maintaining the ecoinvent database—a comprehensive life cycle inventory database that provides reliable and transparent information on the environmental impacts of various products and services. It is used by companies, researchers, and policymakers to analyze the environmental impacts of their operations and make informed decisions.


    Interested in this unique opportunity?

    Please submit your complete application through our LinkedIn posting, including your CV and possible start date.


    • Please note that immigration sponsorship is not possible for this role.

Vous êtes enthousiaste et fiable, avec d’excellentes aptitudes interpersonnelles et techniques. Vous aspirez à un nouveau challenge professionnel dans une entreprise stable et dynamique, avec des valeurs humaines fortes.
Effectuer les analyses statistiques en assurant la cohérence des indicateurs et présenter les résultats au travers de tableaux de bord ou des rapports visuels
Identifier et formaliser les besoins en information et en analyse
Décrire les procédures requises de collecte et de nettoyage des données
Documenter les méthodes statistiques et spécifier les règles de gestion

Tenir à jour le catalogue de données et suivre la qualité des informations restituées et l'utilisation des analyses en service
Identifier les tendances, les modèles et les anomalies dans les données
Minimum de 5 ans d'expérience en Business Analyse et en mise en œuvre de solutions BI (QlikView, QlikSense).

Nous sommes impatients d'en savoir plus sur vous !

Si vous êtes Data Analyst, cette annonce est pour vous...!


Vous êtes enthousiaste et fiable, avec d’excellentes aptitudes interpersonnelles et techniques. Vous aspirez à un nouveau challenge professionnel dans une entreprise stable et dynamique, avec des valeurs humaines fortes.


Responsabilités:

  • Effectuer les analyses statistiques en assurant la cohérence des indicateurs et présenter les résultats au travers de tableaux de bord ou des rapports visuels
  • Identifier et formaliser les besoins en information et en analyse
  • Décrire les procédures requises de collecte et de nettoyage des données
  • Documenter les méthodes statistiques et spécifier les règles de gestion
  • Gérer les données manquantes ou inconsistantes
  • Spécifier les besoins d'automatisation pour l’extraction, l'intégration ou la mise à jour des données
  • Tenir à jour le catalogue de données et suivre la qualité des informations restituées et l'utilisation des analyses en service
  • Identifier les tendances, les modèles et les anomalies dans les données


Profil recherché:

  • Minimum de 5 ans d'expérience en Business Analyse et en mise en œuvre de solutions BI (QlikView, QlikSense).
  • Expertise en modélisation d'entrepôts de données.
  • Connaissance des outils statistiques (SAS, R) souhaitée.
  • Capacité à travailler de manière autonome, avec curiosité et excellentes compétences en communication avec les équipes métiers.
  • Diplôme de Master en sciences informatiques ou équivalent obligatoire


Nous sommes impatients d'en savoir plus sur vous !

3981247594,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/sustainability-data-analyst-at-emea-recruitment-3981247594?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=RaXHzNvTFp3QeNr3Zx2a4Q%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Sustainability Data Analyst,EMEA Recruitment,"Zurich, Switzerland","My client is a global leader in the FMCG industry who are outgrowing the market within their industry by continuously adding to their innovative portfolio. My client is seeking a Sustainability Data Analyst on a 3-6 month contract, who can help monitor the ESG & Sustainability data within their portfolio of suppliers.
The Sustainability Data Analyst report into the VP of Sustainability you will be acquiring data from some of their largest suppliers to ensure compliance and ESG standards throughout.
This role is based in Switzerland and can be fully remote.
As the Sustainability Data Analyst you will be the go to contact for any queries from suppliers within Carlsberg’s portfolio regarding Sustainability & Regulatory data.
By analysing the data you will identify trends, errors and gaps within the reports/templates from the suppliers to increase awareness & key areas of improvement for the sustainability team.
Help contribute to the organisations overall ESG & Sustainability strategy by gaining valuable data insights throughout the organisation’s portfolio.
Being the main point of contact for any queries or questions around the suppliers ESG & Sustainability reporting templates as they are being introduced.
Accountable for monitoring Sustainability data through the organisation’s suppliers.
Manage the Sustainability reports for 30-40 accounts to have full visibility of the organisation’s portfolio ESG & Sustainability status.
Communicate with clients on how to correctly input data for the Sustainability reports.
Present recommended data to the Sustainability team through Excel identifying key trends.
Understanding of Procurement/Supply Chain suppliers. (Experience is desired, not a must)
Strong Communicator, with the ability to present and work with senior Stakeholders.
Degree in Business Administration, Sustainability or Energy. (Desired)
If you are interested in applying for this role, please register your interest using the link in the below comments. Alternatively, please send your CV to benjamin.betts@emearecruitment.com
If you do not hear from us within two weeks, unfortunately, you have been unsuccessful. To be assured of a response, please apply via emearecruitment.com

We act as a neutral third party in the recruitment process, basing our candidate searches on skills and experience. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, gender, sex, relationship status, disability, race, religion/beliefs, or sexual orientation.

3967062391,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-rh-h-f-at-rolex-3967062391?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=n44yf5RkBBgX4gR3VPMYbg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data analyst RH (H/F),ROLEX,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Pour notre division Ressources Humaines, nous recherchons un Data analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera la création de rapports, la modélisation de données et la mise en place de solutions analytiques pour soutenir les prises de décision stratégiques.
Aider dans l’élaboration et la mise en place de la feuille de route du reporting RH
Collaborer avec les équipes métier pour comprendre leurs besoins et les traduire en indicateurs clés
Collaborer avec la division Informatique afin d’automatiser les extractions de données et d’enrichir nos sources de données
Participer aux demandes internes et externes liées aux statistiques et reporting sur les données du personnel
Développer des tableaux de bord, des rapports et des visuels clairs et pertinents pour présenter les résultats d’analyse
Contribuer à l’amélioration continue des processus et des outils en lien avec le reporting de données
Formation supérieure ou universitaire dans le domaine de la data
Expérience réussie de minimum 3 dans le domaine de l’analyse de données
Connaissance du domaine RH et des outils informatiques liés, un atout
Maîtrise des outils informatiques usuels et en particulier SAP, Tableau, Excel, outils d’extraction de données (Tableau Prep)
Sens aigu de la confidentialité et de la discrétion
Gestion des priorités avec une approche méthodologique
Bonne communication, à l'écoute et orienté clients
Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.
Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

Pour notre division Ressources Humaines, nous recherchons un Data analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera la création de rapports, la modélisation de données et la mise en place de solutions analytiques pour soutenir les prises de décision stratégiques.

Responsabilités

  • Aider dans l’élaboration et la mise en place de la feuille de route du reporting RH
  • Collaborer avec les équipes métier pour comprendre leurs besoins et les traduire en indicateurs clés
  • Collaborer avec la division Informatique afin d’automatiser les extractions de données et d’enrichir nos sources de données
  • Participer aux demandes internes et externes liées aux statistiques et reporting sur les données du personnel
  • Développer des tableaux de bord, des rapports et des visuels clairs et pertinents pour présenter les résultats d’analyse
  • Contribuer à l’amélioration continue des processus et des outils en lien avec le reporting de données

Profil

  • Formation supérieure ou universitaire dans le domaine de la data
  • Expérience réussie de minimum 3 dans le domaine de l’analyse de données
  • Connaissance du domaine RH et des outils informatiques liés, un atout
  • Maîtrise des outils informatiques usuels et en particulier SAP, Tableau, Excel, outils d’extraction de données (Tableau Prep)
  • Sens aigu de la confidentialité et de la discrétion
  • Gestion des priorités avec une approche méthodologique
  • Esprit d’analyse et de synthèse
  • Bonne communication, à l'écoute et orienté clients

Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

3978345785,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-etat-de-vaud-3978345785?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=Z98f%2F4%2BFy2OkNTH7oTTuHg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,Etat de Vaud,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Merci de postuler selon les modalités mentionnées sur l'annonce (rendez-vous sur www.vd.ch/offres-demploi). Les profils partagés via LinkedIn ne seront pas traités.

La Direction générale de la santé (DGS) œuvre pour que chaque vaudoise et vaudois puisse accéder à un système de santé efficient, garantissant une prise en charge optimale en matière de soins. Si vous souhaitez vous engager à nos côtés dans un domaine passionnant, avec un environnement de travail dynamique privilégiant l’autonomie et la flexibilité dans l’organisation de votre travail, alors cette annonce est faite pour vous.

En votre qualité de Data analyst au sein du Pôle Santé numérique et qualité (SNQ), vous avez pour mission de concevoir et mettre en œuvre des méthodes de gestion et de mise à jour régulière des données dans la plateforme d’information du système de santé vaudois Infosan et mettez à disposition, des utilisateur·trice·s, toute la documentation nécessaire.
En votre qualité de Data analyst au sein du Pôle Santé numérique et qualité (SNQ), vous :

concevez et mettez en œuvre des méthodes de gestion et de mise à jour régulière des données dans la plateforme d’information du système de santé vaudois Infosan et mettez à disposition, des utilisateur·trice·s, toute la documentation nécessaire

faites un état des lieux, analysez les besoins en informations (formats à transmettre, fréquence, public cible) et les produisez sous forme d’indicateurs. Vous construisez une logique de présentation des informations et les programmez de manière autonome ainsi que proposez des indicateurs pertinents pour faire évoluer la plateforme
assurez le traitement de données de routine, leur plausibilisation, exploitation et publication dans la plateforme Infosan (outils SAS), et la continuité de leur mise à jour
intégrez et documentez de nouveaux indicateurs dans la plateforme Infosan et assurez les travaux d’assurance Qualité dans Infosan
fournissez une expertise en Data Sciences aux Directions et collaborateur·trice·s de la Direction générale de la santé dans le cadre d'Infosan ou d’autres travaux de Monitorage

veillez à ce que les utilisateur·trice·s métiers disposent des informations nécessaires en pilotant la mise en place des processus et en organisant des séances de coordination pour faciliter leur acceptation et intégration.
Pour de plus amples informations, veuillez consulter le cahier des charges en cliquant ici ou contacter Monsieur Lionel Meylan au 021 316 42 29.
Titulaire d'un Master en sciences des données ou titre jugé équivalent.
Formations complémentaires en gestion de projet, en économie et politique de la santé ou formation en santé publique, un atout.
Minimum 2 années d’expérience professionnelle dans le traitement, la plausibilisation et l’exploitation de donnée, idéalement dans le domaine de la santé ou une administration publique.
Maîtrise des outils de traitement informatique et en visualisation des données (SAS/SQL, R ou/et Python
column2: Tableau) et compétences en Data sciences.

column1: Connaissances du système de santé suisse.
Capacités d’analyse et de synthèse, vision globale et être force de proposition.
Bonnes capacités d’organisation, maîtrise de soi et gestion du stress.
Aptitude à travailler de manière autonome et en équipe, esprit d’entraide et de collaboration.

À la Direction générale de la santé (DGS), nous œuvrons pour que l’ensemble de la population vaudoise bénéficie de conditions favorables à la santé et de solutions de qualité, respectueuses de ses droits et de l’éthique, et pour des professionnel·le·s de santé au cœur de la réponse aux besoins évolutifs de la population.

Nous anticipons les besoins et les enjeux de santé publique. Nous définissons, planifions et finançons les missions des acteur·rice·s et co-construisons les dispositifs du système de santé et de promotion de la santé. Nous garantissons la disponibilité et l’accessibilité de ressources adéquates et efficientes pour favoriser le maintien en santé, soigner et réhabiliter. Nous renforçons l’agilité et la capacité d’innovation de la politique de santé publique et du système de santé.
Pour plus d’informations, cliquez ici afin de consulter notre site.
L’Etat de Vaud propose aux près de 40'000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs de l’Administration cantonale vaudoise (ACV) une grande diversité d’emplois et d’opportunités d’évolution.

Les conditions de travail offertes ont comme ligne directrice les thématiques d’égalité, d’inclusion, de durabilité et d’éthique professionnelle dans un environnement propice à la conciliation entre vie professionnelle et vie privée.
Pour en savoir plus sur nos avantages, rendez-vous sur notre page Etat employeur.

Merci de postuler selon les modalités mentionnées sur l'annonce (rendez-vous sur www.vd.ch/offres-demploi). Les profils partagés via LinkedIn ne seront pas traités.


DESCRIPTION DE L'EMPLOI

La Direction générale de la santé (DGS) œuvre pour que chaque vaudoise et vaudois puisse accéder à un système de santé efficient, garantissant une prise en charge optimale en matière de soins. Si vous souhaitez vous engager à nos côtés dans un domaine passionnant, avec un environnement de travail dynamique privilégiant l’autonomie et la flexibilité dans l’organisation de votre travail, alors cette annonce est faite pour vous.

En votre qualité de Data analyst au sein du Pôle Santé numérique et qualité (SNQ), vous avez pour mission de concevoir et mettre en œuvre des méthodes de gestion et de mise à jour régulière des données dans la plateforme d’information du système de santé vaudois Infosan et mettez à disposition, des utilisateur·trice·s, toute la documentation nécessaire.


RESPONSABILITÉS

En votre qualité de Data analyst au sein du Pôle Santé numérique et qualité (SNQ), vous :

  • concevez et mettez en œuvre des méthodes de gestion et de mise à jour régulière des données dans la plateforme d’information du système de santé vaudois Infosan et mettez à disposition, des utilisateur·trice·s, toute la documentation nécessaire
column2: • faites un état des lieux, analysez les besoins en informations (formats à transmettre, fréquence, public cible) et les produisez sous forme d’indicateurs. Vous construisez une logique de présentation des informations et les programmez de manière autonome ainsi que proposez des indicateurs pertinents pour faire évoluer la plateforme
column3: • assurez le traitement de données de routine, leur plausibilisation, exploitation et publication dans la plateforme Infosan (outils SAS), et la continuité de leur mise à jour
column4: • intégrez et documentez de nouveaux indicateurs dans la plateforme Infosan et assurez les travaux d’assurance Qualité dans Infosan
column5: • fournissez une expertise en Data Sciences aux Directions et collaborateur·trice·s de la Direction générale de la santé dans le cadre d'Infosan ou d’autres travaux de Monitorage

• veillez à ce que les utilisateur·trice·s métiers disposent des informations nécessaires en pilotant la mise en place des processus et en organisant des séances de coordination pour faciliter leur acceptation et intégration.

    • Pour de plus amples informations, veuillez consulter le cahier des charges en cliquant ici ou contacter Monsieur Lionel Meylan au 021 316 42 29.


    QUALIFICATIONS

    • Titulaire d'un Master en sciences des données ou titre jugé équivalent.
    • Formations complémentaires en gestion de projet, en économie et politique de la santé ou formation en santé publique, un atout.
    • Minimum 2 années d’expérience professionnelle dans le traitement, la plausibilisation et l’exploitation de donnée, idéalement dans le domaine de la santé ou une administration publique.
    • Maîtrise des outils de traitement informatique et en visualisation des données (SAS/SQL, R ou/et Python
column7:
Tableau) et compétences en Data sciences.
  • Connaissances du système de santé suisse.
  • Capacités d’analyse et de synthèse, vision globale et être force de proposition.
  • Bonnes capacités d’organisation, maîtrise de soi et gestion du stress.
  • Aptitude à travailler de manière autonome et en équipe, esprit d’entraide et de collaboration.


    • QUI SOMMES-NOUS?

    À la Direction générale de la santé (DGS), nous œuvrons pour que l’ensemble de la population vaudoise bénéficie de conditions favorables à la santé et de solutions de qualité, respectueuses de ses droits et de l’éthique, et pour des professionnel·le·s de santé au cœur de la réponse aux besoins évolutifs de la population.

    Nous anticipons les besoins et les enjeux de santé publique. Nous définissons, planifions et finançons les missions des acteur·rice·s et co-construisons les dispositifs du système de santé et de promotion de la santé. Nous garantissons la disponibilité et l’accessibilité de ressources adéquates et efficientes pour favoriser le maintien en santé, soigner et réhabiliter. Nous renforçons l’agilité et la capacité d’innovation de la politique de santé publique et du système de santé.

    Pour plus d’informations, cliquez ici afin de consulter notre site.


    POURQUOI REJOINDRE L'ÉTAT DE VAUD?

    L’Etat de Vaud propose aux près de 40'000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs de l’Administration cantonale vaudoise (ACV) une grande diversité d’emplois et d’opportunités d’évolution.

    Les conditions de travail offertes ont comme ligne directrice les thématiques d’égalité, d’inclusion, de durabilité et d’éthique professionnelle dans un environnement propice à la conciliation entre vie professionnelle et vie privée.

    Pour en savoir plus sur nos avantages, rendez-vous sur notre page Etat employeur.


    Délai de postulation : 11.08.24

3959552371,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-24-months-at-panerai-3959552371?position=10&pageNum=0&refId=R3efp525VW1HZs63f0Wsfw%3D%3D&trackingId=mnv6c8PtemVCySWB8%2Bs4QQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst (24 months),Panerai,"Neuchâtel, Neuchâtel, Switzerland","In order to reinforce our Operations Data team, within our Supply Chain department we are currently recruiting a:

Within our integrated end-to-end Supply Chain, you will be in charge of developing and maintaining analytics reports to facilitate decision making for the department, and ensure data integrity and quality. This role is committed to leveraging data to optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of main internal processes. It involves tasks like analyzing data to identify trends and inefficiencies, developing data-driven recommendations for improvement, and creating reports and visualizations to communicate insights to stakeholders. Ultimately, your goal will be to use data to streamline operations, reduce costs, and improve customer satisfaction.
HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT ?
Collaborate with Supply Chain teams to gather and analyze data on procurement, inventory management, warehousing, production, and sales.
Utilize data analysis tools and techniques to identify trends, patterns, and root causes of inefficiencies.
Maintain established portfolio of data-driven solutions to optimize Supply Chain processes, such as forecasting models for demand planning and inventory management strategies.
Create clear and concise reports and visualizations to communicate complex data insights to stakeholders across different departments.
Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of Supply Chain initiatives.
Stay up-to-date on the latest data analysis trends and technologies.
Partner with other Business Analysts from other departments including IT, Commercial, Finance, and Operations
Master degree in Engineering, Business Analytics, Data Science, Supply Chain Management, or a related field
Proven previous experience with data analysis tools and techniques, such as Power BI and Python
Previous experience with Google Cloud ecosystem is a plus
Strong understanding of statistical analysis concepts
Experience working in a Supply Chain environment is a plus
Comfortable in changing and evolving contexts
Strong communication skills with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders and teams
How Do We Keep You Smiling
You will be part of a dynamic Maison where your skills and talents will be recognized
You will share with us the same values as ""enriching communities, care attitude, continuous improvement, efficient accountability""
You will work in a multicultural team and develop international experience
You will navigate with us on our sustainability journey
You will develop and take your career at the next level with potential opportunities within the Maison and the Richemont Group
1st stage - After your application has been selected, our recruitment team will reach out to you within 2 weeks to conduct an introductury call
2nd stage - Interview with the Line Manager
3rd stage - Interview with the HR Manager / Director

Panerai is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We want to offer an inclusive environment of mutual respect and we are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination based on gender, gender expression, disability, origin, background, religious beliefs or sexual orientation or any other basis protected by law.

In order to reinforce our Operations Data team, within our Supply Chain department we are currently recruiting a:

Data Analyst

Your Mission

Within our integrated end-to-end Supply Chain, you will be in charge of developing and maintaining analytics reports to facilitate decision making for the department, and ensure data integrity and quality. This role is committed to leveraging data to optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of main internal processes. It involves tasks like analyzing data to identify trends and inefficiencies, developing data-driven recommendations for improvement, and creating reports and visualizations to communicate insights to stakeholders. Ultimately, your goal will be to use data to streamline operations, reduce costs, and improve customer satisfaction.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT ?

  • Collaborate with Supply Chain teams to gather and analyze data on procurement, inventory management, warehousing, production, and sales.
  • Utilize data analysis tools and techniques to identify trends, patterns, and root causes of inefficiencies.
  • Maintain established portfolio of data-driven solutions to optimize Supply Chain processes, such as forecasting models for demand planning and inventory management strategies.
  • Create clear and concise reports and visualizations to communicate complex data insights to stakeholders across different departments.
  • Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of Supply Chain initiatives.
  • Stay up-to-date on the latest data analysis trends and technologies.
  • Partner with other Business Analysts from other departments including IT, Commercial, Finance, and Operations

How Will You Experience Success

  • Master degree in Engineering, Business Analytics, Data Science, Supply Chain Management, or a related field
  • Proven previous experience with data analysis tools and techniques, such as Power BI and Python
  • Previous experience with Google Cloud ecosystem is a plus
  • Strong understanding of statistical analysis concepts
  • Microsoft office expert, especially Excel
  • Experience working in a Supply Chain environment is a plus
  • Fluent French, advanced English
  • Analytical &
column2:
synthetic mindset
  • Autonomous, results-driven, rigorous and proactive
  • Comfortable in changing and evolving contexts
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders and teams

    • How Do We Keep You Smiling

    • You will be part of a dynamic Maison where your skills and talents will be recognized
    • You will share with us the same values as ""enriching communities, care attitude, continuous improvement, efficient accountability""
    • You will work in a multicultural team and develop international experience
    • You will navigate with us on our sustainability journey
    • You will develop and take your career at the next level with potential opportunities within the Maison and the Richemont Group

    INTERVIEW PROCESS

    1st stage - After your application has been selected, our recruitment team will reach out to you within 2 weeks to conduct an introductury call

    2nd stage - Interview with the Line Manager

    3rd stage - Interview with the HR Manager / Director

    Panerai is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We want to offer an inclusive environment of mutual respect and we are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination based on gender, gender expression, disability, origin, background, religious beliefs or sexual orientation or any other basis protected by law.
